Get-Pfa2ProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) List protection groups

Displays a list of protection groups, including their associated source arrays, replication targets, hosts count, host groups count, and volumes count. The list includes protection groups that were created on the local array to replicate snapshot data to other arrays or offload targets, created on a remote array and replicated asynchronously to this array, or created inside a pod on a remote array and stretched to the local array.

Get-Pfa2ProtectionGroup Aliases

  • Get-Pfa2PGroup

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2ProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2ProtectionGroup -Array $Array -Name $ProtectionGroupName
Get protection group from FlashArray where name is $ProtectionGroupName
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2ProtectionGroup -Array $Array | Where-Object { $_.Name -eq $NewProtectionGroupName }
Get all protection groups from FlashArray and client filters locally using Where-Object
Example 3 
Get-Pfa2ProtectionGroup -Array $Array -Destroyed $false
Get all protection groups from FlashArray which are currently not destroyed

Top of page

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Create a protection group

Creates a protection group on the local array for asynchronous replication. For more information of creating volumes under SafeMode, run `Get-Help About_Pfa2Safemode`

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroup Aliases

  • New-Pfa2PGroup

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Name <String>] [-Overwrite <Boolean>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Overwrite none If set to `$True`, overwrites an existing volume during a volume copy operation. If set to `$False` or not set at all and the target name is an existing volume, the volume copy operation fails. Required if the `source: id` or `source: name` body parameter is set and the source overwrites an existing volume during the volume copy operation. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames The name of the protection group or protection group snapshot to be copied into a new or existing protection group. If the destination protection group and all of its volumes already exist, include the `Overwrite` parameter to overwrite all of the existing volumes with the snapshot contents. If including the `Overwrite` parameter, the names of the volumes that are being overwritten must match the names of the volumes that are being restored. If the source is a protection group, the latest snapshot of the protection group will be used as the source during the copy operation. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
New-Pfa2ProtectionGroup -Array $Array -Name $ProtectionGroupName
Create a protection group on FlashArray with name $ProtectionGroupName

Top of page

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a protection group

Deletes a protection group that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated protection groups cannot be recovered. Protection groups are destroyed through the `Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup` method. The `Name` parameter is required.

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroup Aliases

  • Remove-Pfa2PGroup

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-Eradicate] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-Eradicate none Permanently delete ProtectionGroup false False False
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroup -Array $Array -Name $NewProtectionGroupName -Eradicate -Confirm:$false
Eradicate protection group with name $NewProtectionGroupName (Only destroyed protection groups can be eradicated)

Top of page

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Modify a protection group

Modifies the protection group schedules to generate and replicate snapshots to another array or to an external storage system. Renames or destroys a protection group.

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup Aliases

  • Update-Pfa2PGroup

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-ProtectionGroupName <String>] [-ReplicationScheduleAt <Int64>] [-ReplicationScheduleBlackoutEnd <Int64>] [-ReplicationScheduleBlackoutStart <Int64>] [-ReplicationScheduleEnabled <Boolean>] [-ReplicationScheduleFrequency <Int64>] [-RetentionLock <String>] [-SnapshotScheduleAt <Int64>] [-SnapshotScheduleEnabled <Boolean>] [-SnapshotScheduleFrequency <Int64>] [-SourceRetentionAllForSec <Int32>] [-SourceRetentionDays <Int32>] [-SourceRetentionPerDay <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionAllForSec <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionDays <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionPerDay <Int32>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none Has this protection group been destroyed? To destroy a protection group, patch to `$True`. To recover a destroyed protection group, patch to `$False`. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-ProtectionGroupName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None
-ReplicationScheduleAt none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule of a replication action. The schedule of a replication action.


maximum: 86399000		 false False None
-ReplicationScheduleBlackoutEnd none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule of a replication action. The schedule of a replication action. The schedule of a replication action. The schedule of a replication action. false False None
-ReplicationScheduleBlackoutStart none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule of a replication action. The schedule of a replication action. The schedule of a replication action. The schedule of a replication action. false False None
-ReplicationScheduleEnabled none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule of a replication action. The schedule of a replication action. false False None
-ReplicationScheduleFrequency none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule of a replication action. The schedule of a replication action.


minimum: 300000


maximum: 34560000000		 false False None
-RetentionLock none (REST API 2.13+) The valid values are `ratcheted` and `unlocked`. The default value for a newly created protection group is `unlocked`. Set `RetentionLock` to `ratcheted` to enable SafeMode restrictions on the protection group. Contact Pure Technical Services to change `RetentionLock` to `unlocked`. false False None
-SnapshotScheduleAt none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule settings for protection group snapshots. The schedule settings for protection group snapshots.


maximum: 86399000		 false False None
-SnapshotScheduleEnabled none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule settings for protection group snapshots. The schedule settings for protection group snapshots. false False None
-SnapshotScheduleFrequency none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule settings for protection group snapshots. The schedule settings for protection group snapshots.


minimum: 300000


maximum: 34560000000		 false False None
-SourceRetentionAllForSec none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the source array of the protection group. The retention policy for the source array of the protection group.


minimum: 60


maximum: 34560000		 false False None
-SourceRetentionDays none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the source array of the protection group. The retention policy for the source array of the protection group.


maximum: 4000		 false False None
-SourceRetentionPerDay none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the source array of the protection group. The retention policy for the source array of the protection group.


maximum: 1440		 false False None
-TargetRetentionAllForSec none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group. The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group.


minimum: 60


maximum: 34560000		 false False None
-TargetRetentionDays none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group. The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group.


maximum: 4000		 false False None
-TargetRetentionPerDay none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group. The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group.


maximum: 1440		 false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup -Array $Array -Name $ProtectionGroupName -ProtectionGroupName $NewProtectionGroupName
Update the name of protection group from $ProtectionGroupName to $NewProtectionGroupName
Example 2 
Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup -Array $Array -Destroyed $true -Name $NewProtectionGroupName
Destroy the protection group with name $NewProtectionGroupname (This is not Eradicated)

Top of page

Connect-Pfa2Array

Connect to an array

Connect to an array (using supported authentication method) and get an access token. For information of setting global PureStoragePowerShellSDK2 options, run `Help about_Pfa2Configuration`.

Syntax 

Connect-Pfa2Array [-ApiVersion <String>] -ClientId <String> [-DisableVerbosePhoneHomeLogging] -Endpoint <String> [-HttpTimeout <Int32>] [-IgnoreCertificateError] -Issuer <String> -KeyId <String> -PrivateKeyFile <String> [-PrivateKeyPassword <SecureString>] -Username <String> [<CommonParameters>]

Connect-Pfa2Array [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Credential <PSCredential>] [-DisableVerbosePhoneHomeLogging] -Endpoint <String> [-HttpTimeout <Int32>] [-IgnoreCertificateError] -Password <SecureString> [-Username <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Connect-Pfa2Array [-ApiVersion <String>] -Credential <PSCredential> [-DisableVerbosePhoneHomeLogging] -Endpoint <String> [-HttpTimeout <Int32>] [-IgnoreCertificateError] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-ClientId none Client ID of the API client that issues the identity token. true False None
-Credential none The credentials for the FlashArray login false False None
-DisableVerbosePhoneHomeLogging none Disables phone home logging of Pure Storage PowerShell SDK activity on the FlashArray false False False
-Endpoint none The FlashArray name or IP address true False None
-HttpTimeout none Sets the timeout value for the HTTP requests for this connection. The default is 30000ms (30 seconds). For information of setting global PureStoragePowerShellSDK2 options, run `Help about_Pfa2Configuration`. false False None
-IgnoreCertificateError none Prevents certificate errors such as an unknown certificate issuer or non-matching names from causing the request to fail. false False False
-Issuer none The name of the identity provider that will be issuing ID Tokens for this API client. This string represents the JWT iss (issuer) claim in ID Tokens issued for this API client. true False None
-KeyId none Key ID of the API client that issues the identity token. true False None
-Password none Password associated with the login name of the array user. true False None
-PrivateKeyFile none Local file path for the PEM encoded private key certificate. true False None
-PrivateKeyPassword none Password, if any, for the PEM encoded private key certificate. false False None
-Username none Login name of the array user for whom the token should be issued. This must be a valid user in the system. true False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Connect-Pfa2Array -Endpoint $ArrayEndpoint -Credential $Cred -IgnoreCertificateError
Create a session with FlashArray using endpoint, and PSCredential
Example 2 
Connect-Pfa2Array -Endpoint $ArrayEndpoint -Username $ArrayUserName -ApiClientName $ApiClient.Name -Issuer $ApiClient.Issuer -ClientId $ApiClient.Id -KeyId $ApiClient.KeyId -PrivateKeyFile $PrivateKeyFile -PrivateKeyPassword $SecurePsw -IgnoreCertificateError
Create a session with FlashArray using API client name, issuer, API keyid and API client id. The API client can be created using New-Pfa2ApiClient
Example 3 
Connect-Pfa2Array -Endpoint $ArrayEndpoint -Username $ArrayUserName -ApiClientName $ApiClient.Name -Issuer $ApiClient.Issuer -ClientId $ApiClient.Id -KeyId $ApiClient.KeyId -PrivateKeyFile $PrivateKeyFile -PrivateKeyPassword $SecurePsw -ApiVersion $_ -IgnoreCertificateError
Create a session with FlashArray using a specific REST version with ApiVersion param
Example 4 
Connect-Pfa2Array -Endpoint $ArrayEndpoint -Username $ArrayUserName -Password $psw -IgnoreCertificateError -ApiVersion $Version
Create a session with the $TargetEndPoint using username $ArrayUserName and secure string password $psw. User ApiVersion to connect to specific REST version. The FlashArray authentication is cached for the duration of the PowerShell session. No -Array parameter is required for subsequent cmdlet for this PowerShell session

Top of page

Disconnect-Pfa2Array

Close the connection to the array

Close the connection to the array

Syntax 

Disconnect-Pfa2Array [-Array <Rest2Api>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Disconnect-Pfa2Array -Array $Array
Disconnect a session with FlashArray

Get-Pfa2ActiveDirectory

(REST API 2.3+) List Active Directory accounts

Displays configured Active Directory accounts.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2ActiveDirectory [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2Admin

(REST API 2.2+) List administrators

Displays a list of administrators.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2Admin [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ExposeApiToken <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ExposeApiToken none If `$True`, exposes the API token of the current user. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2Admin -Array $Array
Get a list of administrators from FlashArray
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2Admin -Array $Array | Where { $_.Name -eq $Name }
Get a list of array administrators and client filters the admins equal $Name

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2AdminApiToken -Array $Array
Get all administrators API token, API token is not exposed.
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2AdminApiToken -Array $Array -ExposeApiToken $True
Get array administrator's API token, API token of current admin is exposed.
Example 3 
Get-Pfa2AdminApiToken -Array $Array -Name $ArrayUsername
Get API token of array administrator whose name is $ArrayUsername

(REST API 2.2+) List alerts

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2Alert [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Flagged <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Flagged none If set to `$True`, lists only flagged messages. If set to `$False`, lists only unflagged messages. if not specified, lists all messages. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2Alert -Array $Array
Get all array alerts
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2Alert -Array $Array -Flagged $True
Get all array alerts that are flagged
Example 3 
Get-Pfa2Alert -Array $Array -Name $_.Name
Get array alert with name $_.Name

Get-Pfa2AlertEvent

(REST API 2.2+) List alert events

Displays a list of alert events.

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Flagged none If set to `$True`, lists only flagged messages. If set to `$False`, lists only unflagged messages. if not specified, lists all messages. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. For example, `name01`. Enter multiple names. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Get-Pfa2ApiClient

(REST API 2.1+) List API clients

Returns a list of API clients.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2ApiClient [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2ApiClient -Array $Array
Get API clients on FlashArray

Top of page

Get-Pfa2ApiVersion

List array supported API information and PowerShell supported API information

Displays array supported API information and PowerShell supported API information

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2ApiVersion -Endpoint <String> [-IgnoreCertificateError] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-Endpoint none The FlashArray name or IP address true False None
-IgnoreCertificateError none Prevents certificate errors such as an unknown certificate issuer or non-matching names from causing the request to fail. false False False

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

Get-Pfa2App

(REST API 2.2+) List apps

Displays a list of installed apps.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2App [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Example 1

Example 2

Syntax

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-AppName AppNames The name of the installed app. Enter multiple names. false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None

Get-Pfa2ArrayPerformance

(REST API 2.2+) List array front-end performance data

Displays real-time and historical front-end performance data at the array level including latency, bandwidth, IOPS, average I/O size, and queue depth.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2ArrayPerformance [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Protocol <String>] [-ProtocolGroup <String>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Protocol none Protocol type. Valid values are `nfs`, `smb`, and `all`. false False None
-ProtocolGroup none Protocol group type. Valid values are `block`, `file`, and `all`. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2ArrayPerformance -Array $Array -StartTime ((Get-Date).AddDays(-1)) -Endtime (Get-Date) -Resolution 28800000
Get array performance data starting from this time yesterday to this time today with a resolution of 8 hours

Top of page

Get-Pfa2ArraySpace

(REST API 2.2+) List array space information

Displays real-time and historical array space information including unique volume and snapshot space, shared space, data reduction, provisioned capacity, usable capacity, and parity.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2ArraySpace [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2ArraySpace  -Array $Array
Get array space data
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2ArraySpace  -Array $Array -StartTime $CurrentTimeAtYesterday -Endtime $CurrentTime -Resolution $ResolutionTime
Get array space data starting from $CurrentTimeAtYesterday to $CurrentTime with a resolution of $ResolutionTime

Top of page

Get-Pfa2ArraysPerformanceByLink

List array front-end IO performance data by link

Displays real-time and historical front-end performance data at the array level including latency, bandwidth, IOPS, average I/O size, and queue depth. Group output is shown by link. A link represents a set of arrays that an I/O operation depends on. For local-only I/Os, this is a local array. For mirrored I/Os, this is a set of synchronous replication peer arrays.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2ArraysPerformanceByLink [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2Audit

(REST API 2.2+) List audits

Displays a list of audits.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2Audit [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2Audit -Array $Array | Where-Object { $_.Arguments.trim() -eq  $ProtectionGroupName }
Get audit of operations of which the argument is equal to $ProtectionGroupName

Get-Pfa2Connection

(REST API 2.0+) List volume connections

Displays a list of connections between a volume and its hosts and host groups, and the logical unit numbers (LUNs) used by the associated hosts to address these volumes.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2Connection [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-HostGroupName <List<String>>] [-HostName <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointId <List<String>>] [-ProtocolEndpointName <List<String>>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-VolumeId <List<String>>] [-VolumeName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-HostGroupName HostGroupNames Performs the operation on the host group specified. Enter multiple names. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple host group names and volume names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `HostGroupName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `hgroup01`). false False None
-HostName HostNames Performs the operation on the hosts specified. Enter multiple names. For example, `host01,host02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple host names and volume names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `HostName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `host01`). false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-ProtocolEndpointId ProtocolEndpointIds Performs the operation on the protocol endpoints specified. Enter multiple IDs. For example, `peid01,peid02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple IDs. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple protocol endpoint IDs and host names. Instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `ProtocolEndpointId`) must be set to one ID (e.g., `peid01`). false False None
-ProtocolEndpointName ProtocolEndpointNames Performs the operation on the protocol endpoints specified. Enter multiple names. For example, `pe01,pe02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple protocol endpoint names and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `ProtocolEndpointName`) must be set to one name (e.g., `pe01`). false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-VolumeId VolumeIds Performs the operation on the specified volume. Enter multiple ids. For example, `vol01id,vol02id`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple IDs. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple volume IDs and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `VolumeId`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `vol01id`). Only one of the two between `VolumeName` and `VolumeId` may be used at a time. false False None
-VolumeName VolumeNames Performs the operation on the volume specified. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple volume names and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `VolumeName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `vol01`). false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2Connection -Array $Array -HostNames $Host_.Name
Get connections the host $Host_.Name is related with
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2Connection -Array $Array | Where { $_.Host.Name -eq $Host_.Name -and $_.Volume.Name -eq $Volume.Name }
Get all of connections and filter by connection host name and volume name
Example 3 
(Get-Pfa2Connection -Array $Array -HostNames $Host_.Name).Volume
Get the volumes that host $Host_.Name connects with
Example 4 
Get-Pfa2Connection -Array $Array -HostGroupNames $HostGroup.Name
Get connections the host group $HostGroup.Name is related with
Example 5 
(Get-Pfa2Connection -Array $Array -HostGroupNames $HostGroup.Name).Volume
Get the volumes that host group $HostGroup.Name connects with

Top of page

Get-Pfa2ContainerDefaultProtection

List container default protections

Displays a list of containers with its default protections.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2ContainerDefaultProtection [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the container ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. Specifying `Id` or `Name` with no value will perform the operation on local array. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique container name specified. Enter multiple names. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. Specifying `Id` or `Name` with no value will perform the operation on local array. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Get-Pfa2DirectoryExport

Get-Pfa2DirectoryExport [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-DirectoryId <List<String>>] [-DirectoryName <List<String>>] [-ExportName <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-DirectoryId DirectoryIds Performs the operation on the unique managed directory IDs specified. Enter multiple managed directory IDs. The `DirectoryId` or `DirectoryName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-DirectoryName DirectoryNames Performs the operation on the managed directory names specified. Enter multiple full managed directory names. For example, `fs:dir01,fs:dir02`. false False None
-ExportName ExportNames Performs the operation on the export names specified. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None

-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Get-Pfa2DirectoryPerformance

(REST API 2.3+) List directory performance data

Displays real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O sizes for each directory and as a total of all directories across the entire array.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2DirectoryPerformance [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Protocol <String>] [-ProtocolGroup <String>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Protocol none Protocol type. Valid values are `nfs`, `smb`, and `all`. false False None
-ProtocolGroup none Protocol group type. Valid values are `block`, `file`, and `all`. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2DirectoryPolicy

(REST API 2.3+) List policies

Displays a list of policies that are attached to directories.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2DirectoryPolicy [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object
