Get-Pfa2DirectoryQuota

(REST API 2.7+) List directories with attached quota policies

Displays a list of directories and the quota policies attached to them. Directories with multiple policies are listed repeatedly (once per policy). The directories without a policy attached are not listed.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2DirectoryQuota [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-DirectoryId <List<String>>] [-DirectoryName <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-DirectoryId DirectoryIds Performs the operation on the unique managed directory IDs specified. Enter multiple managed directory IDs. The `DirectoryId` or `DirectoryName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-DirectoryName DirectoryNames Performs the operation on the managed directory names specified. Enter multiple full managed directory names. For example, `fs:dir01,fs:dir02`. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Get-Pfa2DirectoryService

(REST API 2.2+) List directory services configuration

Displays the role-based access control (RBAC) group configuration settings for manageability.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2DirectoryService [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2DirectoryService -Array $Array
Get directory service information of the FlashArray
Example 2 
(Get-Pfa2DirectoryService -Array $Array).Name
Get name list of all of directory services

Top of page

Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalGroup

List local groups

Displays a list of local groups.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Gids <List<Int>>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sid <List<String>>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Gids none Performs the operation on the specified GIDs. Enter multiple GIDs. For example, `4234235,9681923`. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sid Sids Performs the operation on the object SID specified. Enter multiple SIDs. For example, `S-1-2-532-582374278-329482934,S-1-2-532-234235245-423425234`. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalGroupMember

List local group memberships

Displays a list of local group memberships.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalGroupMember [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-GroupGid <List<Int>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-GroupSid <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-MemberId <List<Int>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-MemberSid <List<String>>] [-MemberType <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-GroupGid GroupGids Performs the operation on the specified GIDs. Enter multiple GIDs. For example, `4234235,9681923`. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the group names specified. Enter multiple group names. For example, `group1,group2`. false False None
-GroupSid GroupSids Performs the operation on the specified group SID. Enter multiple group SIDs. For example, `S-1-2-532-582374278-329482934,S-1-2-532-234235245-423425234`. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique local member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. For local group IDs refer to group IDs (GID). For local user IDs refer to user IDs (UID). The `MemberId` and `MemberName` parameters cannot be provided together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-MemberSid MemberSids Performs the operation on the specified member SID. Enter multiple member SIDs. For example, `S-1-2-532-582374278-329482934,S-1-2-532-234235245-423425234`. false False None
-MemberType MemberTypes Performs the operation on the member types specified. The type of member is the full name of the resource endpoint. Valid values include `user`, 'group' and 'external'. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Syntax

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sid Sids Performs the operation on the object SID specified. Enter multiple SIDs. For example, `S-1-2-532-582374278-329482934,S-1-2-532-234235245-423425234`. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-Uids none A list of local user IDs (UIDs). Enter multiple local user IDs. For example, `423,51234`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceRole

(REST API 2.2+) List directory services roles

Displays the role-based access control (RBAC) group role settings.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceRole [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-RoleName <List<String>>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-RoleName RoleNames Performs the operation on the unique roles specified. For example, `array_admin`. Enter multiple roles. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceRole -Array $Array -RoleNames $ArrayAdmin
Get directory service role information of the FlashArray by role name $ArrayAdmin
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceRole -Array $Array
Get information of all of directory service roles

Top of page

Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceTest

(REST API 2.2+) List directory services test results

Displays the directory services test and displays the results. The test verifies that URIs can be resolved and that the array can bind and query the tree using the bind user credentials. The test also verifies that the array can find all configured groups to ensure the common names and group base are correctly configured.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceTest [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] -Name <String> [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. For example, `name01`. Enter multiple names. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Get-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot

(REST API 2.3+) List directory snapshots

Displays a list of directory snapshots, including those pending eradication.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-SourceId SourceIds Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2DirectorySpace

(REST API 2.3+) List directory space information

Displays physical storage consumption data for each directory.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2DirectorySpace [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

minimum: 1		 false False None

For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2Hardware

(REST API 2.2+) List hardware component information

Displays a list of hardware slots and bays and status of installed components.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2Hardware [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2Host

(REST API 2.0+) List hosts

Displays a list of hosts.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2Host [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2Host -Array $Array -Name $HostName
Get a host by name
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2Host -Array $Array | Where-Object { $_.Name -eq $HostName }
Get all of hosts and filter by name $HostName
Example 3 
Get-Pfa2Host -Array $Array
Get all hosts from FlashArray

-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None

Get-Pfa2HostGroupHost

(REST API 2.0+) List host groups that are associated with hosts

Returns a list of host groups that are associated with hosts.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2HostGroupHost [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2HostGroupHost -Array $Array -GroupNames $HostGroupName
Get all of hosts added to host group $HostGroupName

Top of page

Get-Pfa2HostGroupPerformance

(REST API 2.0+) List host group performance data

Displays real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O sizes of all host groups, displayed both by host group and by total size across all host groups. This data represents volumes that are connected to the host groups on the local array and stretched volumes connected to the host groups on arrays that are connected by synchronous replication.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2HostGroupPerformance [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2HostGroupPerformance -Array $Array -Name $HostGroupName
Get performance data of host group $HostGroupName
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2HostGroupPerformance -Array $Array | Where-Object { $_.Name -eq $HostGroupName }
Get performance data of all host groups and filter by host group name $HostGroupName

Top of page

Get-Pfa2HostGroupPerformanceByArray

(REST API 2.0+) List host group performance data by array

Displays real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O size data. The data is displayed by total size across all host groups on each array and by individual host group on each array. The displayed data represents the volumes that are connected to a host group on the current array and the volumes that are connected to a host group on any remote arrays that are visible to the current array.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2HostGroupPerformanceByArray [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Get-Pfa2HostPerformance

(REST API 2.0+) List host performance data

Displays real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O sizes across all hosts, displayed by host and by total size across all hosts. This data represents volumes that are connected to the hosts on the local array and stretched volumes connected to the hosts on any arrays that are connected by synchronous replication.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2HostPerformance [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2HostPerformance -Array $Array -Name $HostName
Get performance data of host $HostName
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2HostPerformance -Array $Array | Where-Object { $_.Name -eq $HostName }
Get performance data of all hosts and filter by host name $HostName

Top of page

Get-Pfa2HostPerformanceByArray

(REST API 2.0+) List host performance data by array

Displays real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O size data. The data is displayed by total size across all hosts on each array and by individual host on each array. The displayed data represents the volumes that are connected to a host on the current array and the volumes that are connected to a host on any remote arrays that are visible to the current array.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2HostPerformanceByArray [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. Get-Pfa2HostProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) List hosts that are members of protection groups

Displays a list of host members that belong to one or more protection groups.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2HostProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Get-Pfa2NetworkInterfacePerformance

(REST API 2.4+) List network performance statistics

Displays network statistics, historical bandwidth, and error reporting for all specified network interfaces.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2NetworkInterfacePerformance [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2NetworkInterfacePortDetail

List SFP port details

Displays Ethernet and Fibre Channel SFP details.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2NetworkInterfacePortDetail [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Get-Pfa2Offload

(REST API 2.1+) List offload targets

Displays a list of offload targets that are connected to the array.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2Offload [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Protocol <String>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Protocol none Protocol type. Valid values are `azure`, `google-cloud`, `nfs`, and `s3`. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2Offload -Array $Array | Where-Object {$_.Name -eq $NFSTargetName}
Get all of offload targets of the FlashArray and filter by name $NFSTargetName

Get-Pfa2Pod

(REST API 2.1+) List pods

Displays a list of pods that are stretched to this array.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2Pod [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.5+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2Pod -Array $Array
Get all PODs from FlashArray
