Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2VirtualMachine

(REST API 2.14+) List Virtual Machines

Displays a list of virtual machines, including those pending eradication. If `VmType` is `vvol`, the `recovery_context` in the response will represent the most recent snapshot of the config vVol. This must be used as the `source` in the `Update-Pfa2VirtualMachine` method when recovering a virtual machine from the destroyed state.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2VirtualMachine [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-VmId <List<String>>] [-VmType <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-VmId VmIds Performs the operation on the unique virtual machine IDs specified. Enter multiple virtual machine IDs in a comma-separated format. false False None
-VmType none The type of virtual machine. The only valid value is `vvol`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2VirtualMachineSnapshot

List Virtual Machine Snapshots

Displays a list of virtual machine snapshots, including those pending eradication. If `VmType` is `vvol`, the `recovery_context` in the response will represent a protection group snapshot containing the virtual machine. This must be used as the `source` in the `New-Pfa2VirtualMachineSnapshot /virtual-machine` method when recovering or overwriting a virtual machine from a snapshot.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2VirtualMachineSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-VmId <List<String>>] [-VmType <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-VmId VmIds Performs the operation on the unique virtual machine IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs in a comma-separated format. false False None
-VmType none The type of virtual machine. The only valid value is `vvol`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2Volume

(REST API 2.0+) List volumes

Displays a list of volumes, including those pending eradication.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2Volume [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array
Get volumes from FlashArray
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array | Where { $_.VolumeGroup.Name -eq $VolGroup.Name } | ForEach-Object {
Get all volume from FlashArray and locally filter and operate only on volumes whose VolumeGroup is $VolGroup.Name
Example 3 
Get-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Name $NewVolumeName
Get volume named $NewVolumeName
Example 4 
Get-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Limit $Limit
Get a limited set of volumes from FlashArray defined by $Limit (See -Offset)
Example 5 
Get-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Offset $Limit
Get all volumes from offset $Limit (See -Limit)
Example 6 
Get-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Filter "name='*$($NamePrefix)*'" -Destroyed $False | Update-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Destroyed $True
Get all non-destroyed volumes from FlashArray using server side filtering (See `help About_Pfa2Filtering` on PowerShell) and destroy all at once using pipeline
Example 7 
Get-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Filter "name='*$($NamePrefix)*'" -Destroyed $True | Remove-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Eradicate -Confirm:$false
Get all destroyed volumes using server side filtering and eradicate them
Example 8 
Get-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Filter "name = '$($Volumes[2].Name)'"
Get all volumes using server side filtering where name equals "$($Volumes[2].Name)". See `help About_Pfa2Filtering` on PowerShell window
Example 9 
Get-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Sort "provisioned"
Get all volumes on FlashArray with server side sorted list. Sorted by field "provisioned"
Example 10 
Get-Pfa2Volume
Get all volumes from FlashArray. Here the FlashArray authentication information is retrieved from Cache. Please see Connect-Pfa2Array
Example 11 
Get-Pfa2Volume -Filter "name ='$($prefix)*'"
Get all volumes from FlashArray with name $prefix using Server side filtering. Here the FlashArray authentication information is retrieved from Cache. Please see Connect-Pfa2Array
Example 12 
Get-Pfa2Volume -Filter "name ='$($prefix)*'" -Limit $limit
Get only a limited set of volumes from FlashArray with name $prefix using Server side filtering. The limit is defined by $Limit
Example 13 
Get-Pfa2Volume -Filter "name ='$($prefix)*'" -Limit $limit -Offset $offset
Get only a limited set of volumes from a given $offset from FlashArray with name $prefix using Server side filtering. The limit is defined by $Limit

Top of page

Get-Pfa2VolumeDiff

(REST API 2.9+) List volume diffs

Displays block differences for the specified volumes.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2VolumeDiff [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-BaseId <String>] [-BaseName <String>] -BlockSize <Int64> [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-NextAllocatedBlockHint <Boolean>] [-Offset <Int32>] -SegmentLength <Int64> [-SegmentOffset <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-BaseId none ID of the volume or volume snapshot that the diff comparison is based on. If a base volume or volume snapshot is not specified, all mapped blocks for the volume or volume snapshot are displayed. The `BaseName` or `BaseId` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-BaseName none Name of the volume or volume snapshot that the diff comparison is based on. If a base volume or volume snapshot is not specified, all mapped blocks for the volume or volume snapshot are displayed. The `BaseName` or `BaseId` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-BlockSize none Granularity at which to compare, in bytes. Must be a multiple of 512. true False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-NextAllocatedBlockHint none If set to `$True`, appends offset of the next allocated block in bytes for the volume specified in `Name` or `Id` to the output `items`. `BaseName` or `BaseId` must not be specified if this is set to `$True`. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-SegmentLength none Length of the segment, in bytes, to compare. true False None
-SegmentOffset none Absolute offset, in bytes, of the segment to compare. Must be a multiple of block_size. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2VolumeGroup

(REST API 2.1+) List volume groups

Displays a list of volume groups, including those pending eradication.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None

-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2VolumeGroup -Array $Array | Where { $_.Name.Contains($prefix) }
Get all volume group from FlashArray and locally filter where name contains a prefix
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2VolumeGroup -Array $Array -Name $VolumeGroup.Name
Get volume group named $VolumeGroup.Name

Top of page

Get-Pfa2VolumeGroupPerformance

(REST API 2.1+) List volume group performance data

Returns real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O sizes for each volume group and and as a total of all volume groups across the entire array.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2VolumeGroupPerformance [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2VolumeGroupPerformance -Array $Array -Name $VolumeGroup.Name
Get performance data of the volume group named $VolumeGroup.Name

Top of page

Get-Pfa2VolumeGroupSpace

(REST API 2.1+) List volume group space information

Displays the provisioned size and physical storage consumption data for each volume group.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2VolumeGroupSpace [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2VolumeGroupSpace -Array $Array -Ids $VolumeGroup.Id
Get space data of the volume group having id of $VolumeGroup.Id

Top of page

Get-Pfa2VolumeGroupVolume

(REST API 2.1+) List volume groups with volumes

Returns a list of volume groups that contain volumes.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2VolumeGroupVolume [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A list of group IDs. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2VolumeGroupVolume -Array $Array -GroupIds $VolumeGroup.Id
Get volumes that are added to volume group of which the group id is $VolumeGroup.Id

Top of page

Get-Pfa2VolumePerformance

(REST API 2.0+) List volume performance data

Returns real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O sizes for each volume and and as a total of all volumes across the entire array.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2VolumePerformance [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2VolumePerformance -Array $Array -Name $Volume.Name
Get volume performance statistics on FlashArray

Top of page

Get-Pfa2VolumePerformanceByArray

(REST API 2.0+) List volume performance data by array

Return real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O size data. The data returned is for each volume on the current array and for each volume on any remote arrays that are visible to the current array. The data is grouped by individual volumes and as a total across all volumes on each array.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2VolumePerformanceByArray [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2VolumeProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) List volumes that are members of protection groups

Displays a list of volume members that belong to one or more protection groups.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2VolumeProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-MemberDestroyed <Boolean>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-MemberDestroyed none (REST API 2.9+) If $True, returns only destroyed member objects. Returns an error if a name of a live member object is specified in the member_names query param. If $False, returns only live member objects. Returns an error if a name of a destroyed member object is specified in the member_names query param. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1

Get protection group from FlashArray with names $PG.Name

Get-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot

(REST API 2.0+) List volume snapshots

Displays a list of volume snapshots, including those pending eradication.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-SourceId SourceIds Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Get-Pfa2VolumeSnapshotTags

(REST API 2.2+) List tags

Displays the list of tags.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2VolumeSnapshotTags [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Namespaces <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-ResourceDestroyed <Boolean>] [-ResourceId <List<String>>] [-ResourceName <List<String>>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Namespaces none (REST API 2.3+) A list of namespaces. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-ResourceDestroyed none If set to `$True`, returns only objects from destroyed resources. Returns an error if the name of a live resource is specified in the `ResourceName` query parameter. If set to `$False`, returns only objects from live resources. Returns an error if the name of a destroyed resource is specified in the `ResourceName` query parameter. false False None
-ResourceId ResourceIds A list of resource IDs. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-ResourceName ResourceNames A list of resource names. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Get-Pfa2VolumeSpace

(REST API 2.0+) List volume space information

Displays the provisioned size and physical storage consumption data for each volume.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2VolumeSpace [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None

-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None

The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2VolumeSpace -Array $Array -Name $Volume.Name
Get volume space statistics on FlashArray

Top of page

Get-Pfa2VolumeTag

(REST API 2.2+) List tags

Displays the list of tags.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2VolumeTag [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Namespaces <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-ResourceDestroyed <Boolean>] [-ResourceId <List<String>>] [-ResourceName <List<String>>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-Namespaces none (REST API 2.3+) A list of namespaces. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-ResourceDestroyed none If set to `$True`, returns only objects from destroyed resources. Returns an error if the name of a live resource is specified in the `ResourceName` query parameter. If set to `$False`, returns only objects from live resources. Returns an error if the name of a destroyed resource is specified in the `ResourceName` query parameter. false False None
-ResourceId ResourceIds A list of resource IDs. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-ResourceName ResourceNames A list of resource names. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1

Get all tags on volume $Volume.Name on FlashArray

Get-Pfa2VolumeVolumeGroup

(REST API 2.1+) List volumes that are in volume groups

Returns a list of volumes that are in a volume group.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2VolumeVolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. For more information of filtering, run `Help About_Pfa2Filtering` false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A list of group IDs. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.


minimum: 1		 false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Syntax 

Invoke-Pfa2CLICommand -CommandText <String> -Credential <PSCredential> -EndPoint <String> [-IgnoreCertificateError] [-TimeOutInMilliSeconds <Int32>] [<CommonParameters>]

Invoke-Pfa2CLICommand -CommandText <String> -EndPoint <String> [-IgnoreCertificateError] -Password <SecureString> [-TimeOutInMilliSeconds <Int32>] -UserName <String> [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-CommandText none The CLI command to run on the FlashArray true False None
-Credential none The credentials for SSH access to the FlashArray true True (ByValue) None
-EndPoint none The management address of the FlashArray true True (ByPropertyName) None
-IgnoreCertificateError none Prevents certificate errors such as an unknown certificate issuer or non-matching names from causing the request to fail. false False False
-Password none The SSH password for the FlashArray true False None
-TimeOutInMilliSeconds none Timeout in milliseconds false False None
-UserName none The SSH username for the FlashArray true False None

  • System.String System.Management.Automation.PSCredential

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1

-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False

New-Pfa2ActiveDirectory

(REST API 2.3+) Create Active Directory account

Creates one or more Active Directory accounts. The `User` and `Password` provided are used to join the array to the specified `Domain`.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ActiveDirectory [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ComputerName <String>] [-DirectoryServer <List<String>>] [-Domain <String>] [-JoinExistingAccount <Boolean>] [-JoinOu <String>] [-KerberosServer <List<String>>] -Name <String> [-Password <SecureString>] [-Tls <String>] [-User <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ComputerName none The name of the computer account to be created in the Active Directory domain. If not specified, defaults to the name of the Active Directory configuration. false False None
-DirectoryServer DirectoryServers A list of directory servers used for lookups related to user authorization. Servers must be specified in FQDN format. All specified servers must be registered to the domain appropriately in the configured DNS of the array and are only communicated with over the secure LDAP (LDAPS) protocol. If not specified, servers are resolved for the domain in DNS. false False None
-Domain none The Active Directory domain to join. false False None
-JoinExistingAccount none (REST API 2.15+) If specified as `$True`, the domain is searched for a pre-existing computer account to join to, and no new account will be created within the domain. The `User` specified when joining a pre-existing account must have permissions to 'read all properties from' and 'reset the password of' the pre-existing account. `JoinOu` will be read from the pre-existing account and cannot be specified when joining to an existing account. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-JoinOu none (REST API 2.8+) The distinguished name of the organizational unit in which the computer account should be created when joining the domain. The `DC=...` components of the distinguished name can be optionally omitted. If not specified, defaults to `CN=Computers`. false False None
-KerberosServer KerberosServers A list of key distribution servers to use for Kerberos protocol. Servers must be specified in FQDN format. All specified servers must be registered to the domain appropriately in the configured DNS of the array. If not specified, servers are resolved for the domain in DNS. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. For example, `name01`. Enter multiple names. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Password none The login password of the user with privileges to create the computer account in the domain. This is not persisted on the array. false False None
-Tls none (REST API 2.15+) TLS mode for communication with domain controllers. Valid values are `required` and `optional`. `required` forces TLS communication with a domain controller. `optional` allows the use of non-TLS communication, TLS will still be preferred, if available. If not specified, defaults to `required`. false False None
-User none The login name of the user with privileges to create the computer account in the domain. This is not persisted on the array. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Password none Password associated with the account. false False None
-RoleName RoleNames Privilege level. Valid values include `array_admin`, `storage_admin`, and `readonly`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

New-Pfa2AdminApiToken

(REST API 2.2+) Create API tokens

Syntax 

New-Pfa2AdminApiToken [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Name <String>] [-Timeout <Int64>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Timeout none The duration of API token validity, in milliseconds. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
New-Pfa2AdminApiToken -Array $Array -Name $ArrayUsername -ErrorAction Stop
Create a new admin API token on FlashArray for admin name $ArrayUsername, call fails if API token already exists
Example 2 
New-Pfa2AdminApiToken -Array $Array -Name $Name
Create a new admin API token on FlashArray for admin name $ArrayUsername
Example 3 
New-Pfa2AdminApiToken -Array $Array -Name $Name -Timeout 1000
Create a new API token for array admin $Name with timeout of 1000 seconds

-Parameter none The parameter of the custom alert rule to modify. Values include `info` and `warning`. Available parameter values can be found in the alert rules catalog. true False None
-Value none The value to use for the custom alert rule. Valid values for an alert code and parameter combination can be found in the alert rules catalog. false False None

-Enabled none If set to `$True`, email notifications will be sent to this watcher for alerts. If set to `$False`, email notifications are disabled. If not specified, defaults to `$True`. false False None
