New-Pfa2ApiClient

(REST API 2.1+) Create an API client

Creates an API client. Newly created API clients are disabled by default. Enable an API client through the `Update-Pfa2ApiClient` method. The `Name`, `MaxRole`, `Issuer`, and `PublicKey` parameters are required.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ApiClient [-AccessTokenTtlInMs <Int64>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Issuer <String>] [-MaxRole <String>] [-Name <String>] [-PublicKey <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AccessTokenTtlInMs none The TTL (Time To Live) length of time for the exchanged access token. Measured in milliseconds. If not specified, defaults to `86400000`.


minimum: 1000


maximum: 86400000		 false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Issuer none The name of the identity provider that will be issuing ID Tokens for this API client. The `iss` claim in the JWT issued must match this string. If not specified, defaults to the API client name. false False None
-MaxRole none The maximum role allowed for ID Tokens issued by this API client. The bearer of an access token will be authorized to perform actions within the intersection of this `MaxRole` and the role of the array user specified as the `sub`. Valid values are `array_admin`, `storage_admin`, `ops_admin`, and `readonly`. Users with the `readonly` (Read Only) role can perform operations that convey the state of the array. Read Only users cannot alter the state of the array. Users with the `ops_admin` (Ops Admin) role can perform the same operations as Read Only users plus enable and disable remote assistance sessions. Ops Admin users cannot alter the state of the array. Users with the `storage_admin` (Storage Admin) role can perform the same operations as Read Only users plus storage related operations, such as administering volumes, hosts, and host groups. Storage Admin users cannot perform operations that deal with global and system configurations. Users with the `array_admin` (Array Admin) role can perform the same operations as Storage Admin users plus array-wide changes dealing with global and system configurations. In other words, Array Admin users can perform all operations. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PublicKey none The API client's PEM formatted (Base64 encoded) RSA public key. Include the `-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----` and `-----END PUBLIC KEY-----` lines. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
New-Pfa2ApiClient -Array $Array -MaxRole $MaxRole -Issuer $Issuer -PublicKey $Certificate -Name $ClientName
Create API client on FlashArray with maxrole as "array_admin" and name as $ClientName

Top of page

New-Pfa2ArrayAuth

Create an API Client

Create an API Client registration on an array for OAuth2 authentication

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ArrayAuth [-AccessTokenTtlMilliSeconds <Int64>] -ApiClientName <String> -Credential <PSCredential> -Endpoint <String> [-Force] -Issuer <String> [-MaxRole <String>] [-SshPublicKeyResponseTimeoutInMilliseconds <Int64>] [-SshPublicKeyTimeoutMilliseonds <Int64>] [<CommonParameters>]

New-Pfa2ArrayAuth [-AccessTokenTtlMilliSeconds <Int64>] -ApiClientName <String> -Endpoint <String> [-Force] -Issuer <String> [-MaxRole <String>] -Password <SecureString> [-SshPublicKeyResponseTimeoutInMilliseconds <Int64>] [-SshPublicKeyTimeoutMilliseonds <Int64>] -Username <String> [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AccessTokenTtlMilliSeconds none Access token time-to-live duration, in milliseconds. false False None
-ApiClientName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and cannot be changed. true False None
-Credential none The credentials for the FlashArray login. true True (ByValue) None
-Endpoint none The FlashArray name or IP address. true False None
-Force none Overwrites an existing ApiClient on the FlashArray if certificates are not found on the local machine. false False False
-Issuer none The name of the identity provider that will be issuing ID Tokens for this API client. This string represents the JWT iss (issuer) claim in ID Tokens issued for this API client. true False None
-MaxRole none The maximum role allowed for ID Tokens issued by this API client. The bearer of an access token will be authorized to perform actions within the intersection of this MaxRole and the role of the array user specified as the JWT sub (subject) claim. Valid max_role values are readonly, ops_admin, array_admin, and storage_admin. Users with the readonly (Read Only) role can perform operations that convey the state of the array. Read Only users cannot alter the state of the array. Users with the ops_admin (Ops Admin) role can perform the same operations as Read Only users plus enable and disable remote assistance sessions. Ops Admin users cannot alter the state of the array. Users with the storage_admin (Storage Admin) role can perform the same operations as Read Only users plus storage related operations, such as administering volumes, hosts, and host groups. Storage Admin users cannot perform operations that deal with global and system configurations. Users with the array_admin (Array Admin) role can perform the same operations as Storage Admin users plus array-wide changes dealing with global and system configurations. In other words, Array Admin users can perform all operations. false False None
-Password none Password associated with the login name of the array user. true False None
-SshPublicKeyResponseTimeoutInMilliseconds none Time to wait for response or error from pureapiclient create. Default is 1000ms false False None
-SshPublicKeyTimeoutMilliseonds none Time to wait for the "Please enter public key" prompt from ssh. Default is 5000ms false False None
-Username none Login name of the array user for whom the token should be issued. This must be a valid user in the system. true False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.Management.Automation.PSCredential

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • PureStorage.Rest.PureApiClientAuthInfo

Examples

Example 1 
New-Pfa2ArrayAuth -Endpoint $endpoint -ApiClientName $clientName -Issuer $issuer -Username $arrayUsername -Password $psw
Create a new API client on FlashArray. The $ClientName must be unique per API client.

Top of page

New-Pfa2ArrayConnection

(REST API 2.4+) Create an array connection

Creates a connection between the current array and the specified array.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ArrayConnection [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ConnectionKey <String>] [-ManagementAddress <String>] [-ReplicationAddress <List<String>>] [-ReplicationTransport <String>] [-Type <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ConnectionKey none The connection key of the target array. false False None
-ManagementAddress none Management IP address of the target array. false False None
-ReplicationAddress ReplicationAddresses IP addresses and FQDNs of the target arrays. Configurable only when `ReplicationTransport` is set to `ip`. If not configured, will be set to all the replication addresses available on the target array at the time of the New-Pfa2ArrayConnection. false False None
-ReplicationTransport none The protocol used to transport data between the local array and the remote array. Valid values are `ip` and `fc`. The default is `ip`. false False None
-Type none The type of replication. Valid values are `async-replication` and `sync-replication`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2ArrayFactoryResetToken

(REST API 2.4+) Create a factory reset token

Creates a token that can be used to perform a factory reset on the array. Factory reset tokens can only be created after the array has been prepared for reset (e.g., all volumes and snapshots must first be eradicated). After a token has been created, operations that would take the array out of the prepared state are disabled (e.g., creating volumes) until all tokens have been deleted.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ArrayFactoryResetToken [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2Certificate

(REST API 2.4+) Create certificate

Creates a certificate object and specifies the valid time period and organization details of the certificate. A certificate can be imported or manually configured.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Certificate [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Certificate <String>] [-CommonName <String>] [-Country <String>] [-Days <Int32>] [-Email <String>] [-IntermediateCertificate <String>] [-Key <String>] [-KeySize <Int32>] [-Locality <String>] [-Name <String>] [-Organization <String>] [-OrganizationalUnit <String>] [-Passphrase <String>] [-State <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Certificate none The text of the certificate. false False None
-CommonName none The common name field listed in the certificate. false False None
-Country none Two-letter country (ISO) code listed in the certificate. false False None
-Days none The number of days that the self-signed certificate is valid. If not specified, defaults to 3650. false False None
-Email none The email field listed in the certificate. false False None
-IntermediateCertificate none The text of the intermediate certificate chains. false False None
-Key Keys The text of private key. false False None
-KeySize none The size of the private key for the certificate in bits. Default is 2048 bits. false False None
-Locality none The locality field listed in the certificate. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Organization none The organization field listed in the certificate. false False None
-OrganizationalUnit none The organizational unit field listed in the certificate. false False None
-Passphrase none The passphrase used to encrypt `private_key`. false False None
-State none The state/province field listed in the certificate. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2CertificateSigningRequest

(REST API 2.4+) Create certificate signing request

Creates a certificate signing request based on the certificate type and parameters.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2CertificateSigningRequest [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-CertificateName <String>] [-CommonName <String>] [-Country <String>] [-Email <String>] [-Locality <String>] [-Organization <String>] [-OrganizationalUnit <String>] [-State <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-CertificateName none The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on. false False None
-CommonName none The common name field listed in the certificate. false False None
-Country none Two-letter country (ISO) code listed in the certificate. false False None
-Email none The email field listed in the certificate. false False None
-Locality none The locality field listed in the certificate. false False None
-Organization none The organization field listed in the certificate. false False None
-OrganizationalUnit none The organizational unit field listed in the certificate. false False None
-State none The state/province field listed in the certificate. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Outputs

New-Pfa2Connection

(REST API 2.0+) Create a connection between a volume and host or host group

Creates a connection between a volume and a host or host group. The `VolumeName` or `VolumeId` and `HostName` or `HostGroupName` query parameters are required.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Connection [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-HostGroupName <List<String>>] [-HostName <List<String>>] [-Lun <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointId <String>] [-ProtocolEndpointName <String>] [-VolumeId <List<String>>] [-VolumeName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-HostGroupName HostGroupNames Performs the operation on the host group specified. Enter multiple names. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple host group names and volume names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `HostGroupName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `hgroup01`). false False None
-HostName HostNames Performs the operation on the hosts specified. Enter multiple names. For example, `host01,host02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple host names and volume names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `HostName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `host01`). false False None
-Lun none The logical unit number (LUN) by which the specified hosts are to address the specified volume. If the LUN is not specified, the system automatically assigns a LUN to the connection. To automatically assign a LUN to a private connection, the system starts at LUN `1` and counts up to the maximum LUN `4095`, assigning the first available LUN to the connection. For shared connections, the system starts at LUN `254` and counts down to the minimum LUN `1`, assigning the first available LUN to the connection. If all LUNs in the `[1...254]` range are taken, the system starts at LUN `255` and counts up to the maximum LUN `4095`, assigning the first available LUN to the connection.


minimum: 1


maximum: 4095		 false False None
-ProtocolEndpointId ProtocolEndpointIds (REST API 2.3+) A protocol endpoint (also known as a conglomerate volume) which acts as a proxy through which virtual volumes are created and then connected to VMware ESXi hosts or host groups. The protocol endpoint itself does not serve I/Os; instead, its job is to form connections between FlashArray volumes and ESXi hosts and host groups. false False None
-ProtocolEndpointName ProtocolEndpointNames (REST API 2.3+) A protocol endpoint (also known as a conglomerate volume) which acts as a proxy through which virtual volumes are created and then connected to VMware ESXi hosts or host groups. The protocol endpoint itself does not serve I/Os; instead, its job is to form connections between FlashArray volumes and ESXi hosts and host groups. false False None
-VolumeId VolumeIds Performs the operation on the specified volume. Enter multiple ids. For example, `vol01id,vol02id`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple IDs. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple volume IDs and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `VolumeId`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `vol01id`). Only one of the two between `VolumeName` and `VolumeId` may be used at a time. false False None
-VolumeName VolumeNames Performs the operation on the volume specified. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple volume names and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `VolumeName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `vol01`). false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
New-Pfa2Connection -Array $Array -HostNames $Host_.Name -VolumeNames $Volume.Name
Create a connection between volume $Volume.Name and host $Host_.Name
Example 2 
New-Pfa2Connection -Array $Array -HostGroupNames $HostGroup.Name -VolumeNames $Volume.Name
Create a connection between volume $Volume.Name and host group $HostGroup.Name

Top of page

New-Pfa2Directory

(REST API 2.3+) Create directory

Creates a managed directory at the specified path. The managed directory name must consist of a file system name prefix and a managed directory name suffix (separated with ':'). The suffix must be between 1 and 63 characters (alphanumeric and '-') in length and begin and end with a letter or number. The suffix must include at least one letter or '-'. Set `Name` to create a managed directory with the specified full managed directory name, or set `FileSystemName` or `FileSystemId` in the query parameters and `suffix` in the body parameters to create a managed directory in the specified file system with the specified suffix. These two options are exclusive.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Directory [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-DirectoryName <String>] [-FileSystemId <List<String>>] [-FileSystemName <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-Path <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-DirectoryName DirectoryNames The managed directory name without the file system name prefix. A full managed directory name is constructed in the form of `FILE_SYSTEM:DIR` where `FILE_SYSTEM` is the file system name and `DIR` is the value of this field. `DirectoryName` is required if `FileSystemName` or `FileSystemId` is set. `DirectoryName` cannot be set if `Name` is set. false False None
-FileSystemId FileSystemIds Performs the operation on the file system ID specified. Enter multiple file system IDs. The `FileSystemId` or `FileSystemName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-FileSystemName FileSystemNames Performs the operation on the file system name specified. Enter multiple file system names. For example, `filesystem01,filesystem02`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Path none Path of the managed directory in the file system. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2DirectoryExport

(REST API 2.3+) Create directory exports

Creates an export of a managed directory. The `DirectoryId` or `DirectoryName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2DirectoryExport [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-DirectoryId <List<String>>] [-DirectoryName <List<String>>] [-ExportName <String>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-DirectoryId DirectoryIds Performs the operation on the unique managed directory IDs specified. Enter multiple managed directory IDs. The `DirectoryId` or `DirectoryName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-DirectoryName DirectoryNames Performs the operation on the managed directory names specified. Enter multiple full managed directory names. For example, `fs:dir01,fs:dir02`. false False None
-ExportName ExportNames The name of the export to create. Export names must be unique within the same protocol. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Creates a membership between a directory with one or more auto managed directory policies. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax

Parameters

-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

New-Pfa2DirectoryPolicyQuota

(REST API 2.7+) Create a membership between a directory and one or more quota policies

Creates a membership between a directory and one or more quota policies. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2DirectoryPolicyQuota [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-IgnoreUsage none Flag used to override checks for quota management operations. If set to `$True`, directory usage is not checked against the `quota_limits` that are set. If set to `$False`, the actual logical bytes in use are prevented from exceeding the limits set on the directory. Client operations might be impacted. If the limit exceeds the quota, the client operation is not allowed. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

New-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalGroupMember

Create local group membership

Creates a local group membership with a group. The `GroupName`, `GroupSid`, or `group_ids` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalGroupMember [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-GroupGid <List<Int>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-GroupSid <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-MemberResourceType <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-GroupGid GroupGids Performs the operation on the specified GIDs. Enter multiple GIDs. For example, `4234235,9681923`. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the group names specified. Enter multiple group names. For example, `group1,group2`. false False None
-GroupSid GroupSids Performs the operation on the specified group SID. Enter multiple group SIDs. For example, `S-1-2-532-582374278-329482934,S-1-2-532-234235245-423425234`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MemberName MemberNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MemberResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

New-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalUser

Create local user

Creates a local user.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalUser [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Email <String>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] -Name <String> [-Password <SecureString>] [-PrimaryGroupId <String>] [-PrimaryGroupName <String>] [-PrimaryGroupResourceType <String>] [-Uid <Int32>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Email none Optional field to set the email of the local user. false False None
-Enabled none If this field is `$False`, the local user will be disabled on creation. Otherwise, the local user will be enabled and functional. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. For example, `name01`. Enter multiple names. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Password none The password of the local user. This field is only required if the `Enabled` field is `$True`. false False None
-PrimaryGroupId none Local group that would be assigned as the primary group of the local user. false False None
-PrimaryGroupName none Local group that would be assigned as the primary group of the local user. false False None
-PrimaryGroupResourceType none Local group that would be assigned as the primary group of the local user. Local group that would be assigned as the primary group of the local user. false False None
-Uid none Optional field to set the UID of the local user. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

New-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalUserMember

Create local user membership

Creates a local user membership with a group. The `MemberName` or `MemberSid` or `MemberId` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalUserMember [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-GroupGid <List<Int>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-GroupResourceType <List<String>>] [-IsPrimary <Boolean>] [-MemberId <List<Int>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-MemberSid <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-GroupGid GroupGids The group GID that should be mapped.


reference: LocalusermembershippostGroups		 false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-GroupName GroupNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-GroupResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-IsPrimary none Determines whether memberships are primary group memberships or not. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique local member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. For local group IDs refer to group IDs (GID). For local user IDs refer to user IDs (UID). The `MemberId` and `MemberName` parameters cannot be provided together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-MemberSid MemberSids Performs the operation on the specified member SID. Enter multiple member SIDs. For example, `S-1-2-532-582374278-329482934,S-1-2-532-234235245-423425234`. false False None

New-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot

(REST API 2.3+) Create directory snapshot

Creates a snapshot of the contents of a directory. The `SourceId` or `SourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ClientName <String>] [-KeepFor <Int64>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-Suffix <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ClientName none The client name portion of the client visible snapshot name. A full snapshot name is constructed in the form of `DIR.CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX` where `DIR` is the managed directory name, `CLIENT_NAME` is the value of this field, and `SUFFIX` is the suffix. The client visible snapshot name is `CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX`. false False None
-KeepFor none The time to keep the snapshots for, in milliseconds. false False None
-SourceId SourceIds Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-Suffix none (REST API 2.4+) The suffix portion of the client visible snapshot name. A full snapshot name is constructed in the form of `DIR.CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX` where `DIR` is the managed directory name, `CLIENT_NAME` is the client name, and `SUFFIX` is the value of this field. The client visible snapshot name is `CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX`. If not specified, defaults to a monotonically increasing number generated by the system. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2Host

(REST API 2.0+) Create a host

Creates a host. The `Name` query parameter is required.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Host [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ChapHostPassword <String>] [-ChapHostUser <String>] [-ChapTargetPassword <String>] [-ChapTargetUser <String>] [-Iqn <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-Nqn <List<String>>] [-Personality <String>] [-PreferredArraysId <List<String>>] [-PreferredArraysName <List<String>>] [-Vlan <String>] [-Wwn <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ChapHostPassword none (REST API 2.3+) Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). false False None
-ChapHostUser none (REST API 2.3+) Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). false False None
-ChapTargetPassword none (REST API 2.3+) Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). false False None
-ChapTargetUser none (REST API 2.3+) Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). false False None
-Iqn Iqns The iSCSI qualified name (IQN) associated with the host. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Nqn Nqns The NVMe Qualified Name (NQN) associated with the host. false False None
-Personality none Determines how the system tunes the array to ensure that it works optimally with the host. Set `Personality` to the name of the host operating system or virtual memory system. Valid values are `aix`, `esxi`, `hitachi-vsp`, `hpux`, `oracle-vm-server`, `solaris`, and `vms`. If your system is not listed as one of the valid host personalities, do not set the option. By default, the personality is not set. false False None
-PreferredArraysId none (REST API 2.3+) A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-PreferredArraysName none (REST API 2.3+) The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-Vlan none The VLAN ID that the host is associated with. If not set or set to `any`, the host can access any VLAN. If set to `untagged`, the host can only access untagged VLANs. If set to a number between `1` and `4094`, the host can only access the specified VLAN with that number. false False None
-Wwn Wwns The Fibre Channel World Wide Name (WWN) associated with the host. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
New-Pfa2Host -Array $Array -Name "$(GetGuidName)"
Create a new host on FlashArray with name "$(GetGuidName)"
Example 2 
New-Pfa2Host -Array $Array -Name $HostName -iqns $iqns -nqns $nqns -wwns $wwns -chap $chap
Create a new host with parameters of Name, iqns, nqns, wwns, and chap. Chap object can be created with New-Pfa2ChapObject cmdlet.

New-Pfa2HostGroupHost

(REST API 2.1+) Add a host to a host group

Adds a host to a host group. Adding a host to a host group automatically connects the host to all volumes associated with the group. Multiple hosts can be belong to a host group, but a host can only belong to one host group. Hosts can be added to host groups at any time. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together, and only one host group can be specified at a time.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2HostGroupHost [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
New-Pfa2HostGroupHost -Array $Array -GroupNames $HostGroup.Name -MemberNames $Host_.Name
Add a host $Host_.Name to hostGroup $HostGroup.Name

Top of page

New-Pfa2HostGroupProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Create a host group

Creates a host group member and assigns to a protection group. Members that are already in the protection group are not affected. For asynchronous replication, only members of the same type can belong to a protection group. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the host group. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2HostGroupProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
New-Pfa2HostGroupProtectionGroup -Array $Array -GroupNames  $ProtectionGroupName -MemberNames $NewHostGroup.Name
Add host group $NewHostGroup.Name to protection group $ProtectionGroupName

New-Pfa2MaintenanceWindow

(REST API 2.2+) Create a maintenance window

Creates a maintenance window that suppresses alerts for a specified period of time. A maintenance window can be manually closed at any time. The `Name` and `Timeout` parameters are required. Set the `Name` parameter to `environment`.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2MaintenanceWindow [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Name <String>] [-Timeout <Int32>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Timeout none The specified length of time that alerts are suppressed during a maintenance window, measured in milliseconds. The maintenance window timeout value must be between `60000` (1 minute) and `86400000` (24 hours). The value entered is rounded down to the nearest minute. The `Name` and `Timeout` parameters must be set together, and the `Name` parameter must be set to `environment`.


maximum: 86400000		 false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
New-Pfa2MaintenanceWindow -Array $Array  -Name "environment" -Time 3600000
Create a maintenance window named "environment" and set time as 3600000 milliseconds

(REST API 2.1+) Create offload target

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Offload [-AmazonS3AccessKeyId <String>] [-AmazonS3Bucket <String>] [-AmazonS3PlacementStrategy <String>] [-AmazonS3SecretAccessKey <String>] [-AmazonS3Uri <String>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-AzureAccountName <String>] [-AzureContainerName <String>] [-AzureSecretAccessKey <String>] [-GoogleCloudAccessKeyId <String>] [-GoogleCloudBucket <String>] [-GoogleCloudSecretAccessKey <String>] [-Initialize <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-NfsAddress <String>] [-NfsMountOptions <String>] [-NfsMountPoint <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

-AzureSecretAccessKey none (REST API 2.3+) Microsoft Azure Blob storage settings. Microsoft Azure Blob storage settings. false False None

-GoogleCloudBucket none (REST API 2.3+) Google Cloud Storage settings. Google Cloud Storage settings. false False None
-GoogleCloudSecretAccessKey none (REST API 2.3+) Google Cloud Storage settings. Google Cloud Storage settings. false False None
-Initialize none If set to `$True`, initializes the Amazon S3/Azure Blob container/Google Cloud Storage in preparation for offloading. The parameter must be set to `$True` if this is the first time the array is connecting to the offload target. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None

New-Pfa2Pod

(REST API 2.1+) Create a pod

Creates a pod on the local array. Each pod must be given a name that is unique across the arrays to which they are stretched, so a pod cannot be stretched to an array that already contains a pod with the same name. After a pod has been created, add volumes and protection groups to the pod, and then stretch the pod to another connected array.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Pod [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-FailoverPreferencesId <List<String>>] [-FailoverPreferencesName <List<String>>] [-Id <String>] [-Name <String>] [-QuotaLimit <Int64>] [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-FailoverPreferencesId none (REST API 2.3+) A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-FailoverPreferencesName none (REST API 2.3+) The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-Id Ids (REST API 2.3+) A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified and cannot refer to another resource. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-QuotaLimit none The logical quota limit of the pod, measured in bytes. Must be a multiple of 512.


minimum: 1048576


maximum: 4503599627370496		 false False None
-SourceId SourceIds (REST API 2.3+) The source pod from where data is cloned to create the new pod. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames (REST API 2.3+) The source pod from where data is cloned to create the new pod. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.5+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
New-Pfa2Pod -Array $TargetArray -Name $RemotePodName
Create a POD on the FlashArray with $RemotePodName

Top of page

New-Pfa2PodArray

(REST API 2.1+) Stretch a pod to an array

Stretches a pod to an array. When a pod is stretched to an array, the data in the arrays over which the pod is stretched is synchronously replicated. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the pod to be stretched. The `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the array over which the pod is to be stretched. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PodArray [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A list of group IDs. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2PodReplicaLink

(REST API 2.2+) Create pod replica links

Creates pod replica links between two arrays. The `LocalPodName` and `RemotePodName` are required. Valid values are `replicating`, `baselining`, `paused`, `unhealthy`, `quiescing`, and `quiesced`. A status of `replicating` indicates that the source array is replicating to the target array. A status of `baselining` indicates that the the initial version of the dataset is being sent. During this phase, you cannot promote the target pod. In addition, changing the link direction might trigger the `baselining` status to recur. A status of `paused ` indicates that data transfer between objects has stopped. A status of `unhealthy` indicates that the link is currently unhealthy and customers must perform some health checks to determine the cause. A status of `quiescing` indicates that the source pod is not accepting new write requests but the most recent changes to the source have not arrived on the target. A status of `quiesced` indicates that the source pod has been demoted and all changes have been replicated to the target pod.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PodReplicaLink [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-LocalPodId <List<String>>] [-LocalPodName <List<String>>] [-RemoteId <List<String>>] [-RemoteName <List<String>>] [-RemotePodId <List<String>>] [-RemotePodName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-LocalPodId LocalPodIds A list of local pod IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `LocalPodName` query parameter. false False None
-LocalPodName LocalPodNames A list of local pod names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `LocalPodId` query parameter. false False None
-RemoteId RemoteIds A list of remote array IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemoteName` query parameter. false False None
-RemoteName RemoteNames A list of remote array names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemoteId` query parameter. false False None
-RemotePodId RemotePodIds A list of remote pod IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemotePodName` query parameter. false False None
-RemotePodName RemotePodNames A list of remote pod names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemotePodId` query parameter. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
New-Pfa2PodReplicaLink -Array $Array -LocalPodNames $LocalPodName -RemoteNames $TargetEndPoint -RemotePodNames $RemotePodName
Create a POD replica link with local pod names $LocalPodName, remote pod names $RemotePodName and remote FlashArray name $TargetEndPoint

Top of page

New-Pfa2PolicyAutodir

Create auto managed directory policies

Creates one or more auto managed directory policies. To copy a policy, set one of either `SourceName` or `SourceId`. Each policy can only have one entry. To create a policy from scratch, policy body is required.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicyAutodir [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Enabled none If set to `$True`, enables the policy. If set to `$False`, disables the policy. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-SourceId SourceIds Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2PolicyAutodirMember

Create auto managed directory policies

Creates a membership between one or more resources with an auto managed directory policy. Applicable resources are directories. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicyAutodirMember [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-MemberResourceType <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MemberName MemberNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MemberResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2PolicyNfs

(REST API 2.3+) Create NFS policies

Creates one or more NFS policies or copies an existing policy. To copy a policy, the `SourceName` or `SourceId` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. To create a policy, policy body is required.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicyNfs [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-UserMappingEnabled <Boolean>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Enabled none If set to `$True`, enables the policy. If set to `$False`, disables the policy. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-SourceId SourceIds Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-UserMappingEnabled none (REST API 2.15+) If set to `$True`, FlashArray queries the joined AD/OpenLDAP server to find the user corresponding to the incoming UID. If set to `$False`, users are defined by UID/GID pair. If not specified, defaults to `$True`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2PolicyNfsClientRule

(REST API 2.3+) Create NFS client policy rules

Creates one or more NFS client policy rules. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicyNfsClientRule [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-RulesAccess <List<String>>] [-RulesAnongid <List<String>>] [-RulesAnonuid <List<String>>] [-RulesClient <List<String>>] [-RulesPermission <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-RulesAccess none Specifies access control for the export. Valid values are `root-squash`, `all-squash`, and `no-squash`. `root-squash` prevents client users and groups with root privilege from mapping their root privilege to a file system. All users with UID 0 will have their UID mapped to anonuid. All users with GID 0 will have their GID mapped to anongid. `all-squash` maps all UIDs (including root) to anonuid and all GIDs (including root) to anongid. `no-squash` allows users and groups to access the file system with their UIDs and GIDs. The default is `root-squash` if not specified.


reference: PolicyrulenfsclientpostRules		 false False None
-RulesAnongid none Any user whose GID is affected by an `RulesAccess` of `root_squash` or `all_squash` will have their GID mapped to `RulesAnongid`. The default `RulesAnongid` is null, which means 65534. Use "" to clear. This value is ignored when user mapping is enabled - see User Guide for more details.


reference: PolicyrulenfsclientpostRules		 false False None
-RulesAnonuid none Any user whose UID is affected by an `RulesAccess` of `root_squash` or `all_squash` will have their UID mapped to `RulesAnonuid`. The default `RulesAnonuid` is null, which means 65534. Use "" to clear.


reference: PolicyrulenfsclientpostRules		 false False None
-RulesClient none Specifies which clients are given access. Accepted notation includes IP, IP mask, or hostname. The default is `*` if not specified.


reference: PolicyrulenfsclientpostRules		 false False None
-RulesPermission none Specifies which read-write client access permissions are allowed for the export. Valid values are `rw` and `ro`. The default is `rw` if not specified.


reference: PolicyrulenfsclientpostRules		 false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2PolicyNfsMember

reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MemberName MemberNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MemberResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MembersExportName none The name of the export to create when applying the export policy to the directory.


reference: PolicymemberexportpostMembers		 true False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

New-Pfa2PolicyQuotaMember

(REST API 2.7+) Create a membership between a managed directory and a quota policy

Creates a membership between one or more managed directories and a quota policy. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicyQuotaMember [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-MemberResourceType <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-IgnoreUsage none Flag used to override checks for quota management operations. If set to `$True`, directory usage is not checked against the `quota_limits` that are set. If set to `$False`, the actual logical bytes in use are prevented from exceeding the limits set on the directory. Client operations might be impacted. If the limit exceeds the quota, the client operation is not allowed. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MemberName MemberNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MemberResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2PolicyQuotaRule

(REST API 2.7+) Create quota policy rules

Creates one or more quota policy rules. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicyQuotaRule [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-RulesEnforced <List<Boolean>>] [-RulesNotifications <List<String>>] -RulesQuotaLimit <List<Int>> [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-IgnoreUsage none Flag used to override checks for quota management operations. If set to `$True`, directory usage is not checked against the `quota_limits` that are set. If set to `$False`, the actual logical bytes in use are prevented from exceeding the limits set on the directory. Client operations might be impacted. If the limit exceeds the quota, the client operation is not allowed. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-RulesEnforced none If set to `$True`, this rule describes an enforced quota. An out-of-space warning is issued if logical space usage exceeds the limit value described in this rule. If set to `$False`, this rule describes an unenforced quota. Alerts and/or notifications are issued when logical space usage exceeds the limit value described in this rule. If not specified, defaults to `$False`.


reference: PolicyrulequotapostRules		 false False None
-RulesNotifications none Targets to notify when usage approaches the quota limit. The list of notification targets is a comma-separated string. Valid values are one or more of `user` and `group`. To notify no targets, use `none`. If not specified, defaults to `none`.


reference: PolicyrulequotapostRules		 false False None
-RulesQuotaLimit none Logical space limit of the quota (in bytes) assigned by the rule. This value cannot be set to 0.


reference: PolicyrulequotapostRules		 true False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2PolicySmb

(REST API 2.3+) Create SMB policies

Creates one or more SMB policies. To copy a policy, set one of either `SourceName` or `SourceId`. Each policy can only have one entry. To create a policy from scratch, policy body is required. To create an SMB policy with access based enumeration enabled, set `AccessBasedEnumerationEnabled=$True`.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicySmb [-AccessBasedEnumerationEnabled <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AccessBasedEnumerationEnabled none (REST API 2.4+) If set to `$True`, enables access based enumeration on the policy. When access based enumeration is enabled on a policy, files and folders within exports that are attached to the policy will be hidden from users who do not have permission to view them. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Enabled none If set to `$True`, enables the policy. If set to `$False`, disables the policy. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-SourceId SourceIds Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

(REST API 2.3+) Create SMB client policy rules

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None

-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-RulesAnonymousAccessAllowed none Specifies whether access to information is allowed for anonymous users. If not specified, defaults to `$False`.


reference: PolicyrulesmbclientpostRules		 false False None
-RulesClient none Specifies which clients are given access. Accepted notation, IP, IP mask, or hostname. The default is `*` if not specified.


reference: PolicyrulesmbclientpostRules		 false False None
-RulesSmbEncryptionRequired none Specifies whether the remote client is required to use SMB encryption. If not specified, defaults to `$False`.


reference: PolicyrulesmbclientpostRules		 false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None
