New-Pfa2PolicySnapshotRule

(REST API 2.3+) Create snapshot policy rules

Creates one or more snapshot policy rules. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicySnapshotRule [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-RulesAt <List<Int>>] -RulesClientName <List<String>> -RulesEvery <List<Int>> -RulesKeepFor <List<Int>> [-RulesSuffix <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-RulesAt none Specifies the number of milliseconds since midnight at which to take a snapshot. The `RulesAt` value can only be set to an hour and must be between 0 and 82800000, inclusive. The `RulesAt` value can only be set on the rule with the smallest `RulesEvery` value. The `RulesAt` value cannot be set if the `RulesEvery` value is not measured in days. The `RulesAt` value can only be set for at most one rule in the same policy.


reference: PolicyrulesnapshotpostRules		 false False None
-RulesClientName none The snapshot client name. A full snapshot name is constructed in the form of `DIR.CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX` where `DIR` is the managed directory name, `CLIENT_NAME` is the snapshot client name, and `SUFFIX` is the snapshot suffix. The client-visible snapshot name is `CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX`.


reference: PolicyrulesnapshotpostRules		 true False None
-RulesEvery none Specifies the interval between snapshots, in milliseconds. The `RulesEvery` value for all rules must be multiples of one another. The `RulesEvery` value must be unique for each rule in the same policy. The `RulesEvery` value must be between 5 minutes and 1 year.


reference: PolicyrulesnapshotpostRules		 true False None
-RulesKeepFor none Specifies the period that snapshots are retained before they are eradicated, in milliseconds. The `RulesKeepFor` value cannot be less than the `RulesEvery` value of the rule. The `RulesKeepFor` value must be unique for each rule in the same policy. The `RulesKeepFor` value must be between 5 minutes and 5 years. The `RulesKeepFor` value cannot be less than the `RulesKeepFor` value of any rule in the same policy with a smaller `RulesEvery` value.


reference: PolicyrulesnapshotpostRules		 true False None
-RulesSuffix none (REST API 2.9+) The snapshot suffix name. A full snapshot name is constructed in the form of `DIR.CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX` where `DIR` is the managed directory name, `CLIENT_NAME` is the snapshot client name, and `SUFFIX` is the snapshot suffix. The client-visible snapshot name is `CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX`. The `RulesSuffix` value can only be set for one rule in the same policy. The `RulesSuffix` value can only be set on a rule with the same `RulesKeepFor` value and `RulesEvery` value. The `RulesSuffix` value can only be set on the rule with the largest `RulesKeepFor` value. If not specified, defaults to a monotonically increasing number generated by the system.


reference: PolicyrulesnapshotpostRules		 false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Create a protection group

Creates a protection group on the local array for asynchronous replication. For more information of creating volumes under SafeMode, run `Get-Help About_Pfa2Safemode`

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroup Aliases

  • New-Pfa2PGroup

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Name <String>] [-Overwrite <Boolean>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Overwrite none If set to `$True`, overwrites an existing volume during a volume copy operation. If set to `$False` or not set at all and the target name is an existing volume, the volume copy operation fails. Required if the `source: id` or `source: name` body parameter is set and the source overwrites an existing volume during the volume copy operation. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames The name of the protection group or protection group snapshot to be copied into a new or existing protection group. If the destination protection group and all of its volumes already exist, include the `Overwrite` parameter to overwrite all of the existing volumes with the snapshot contents. If including the `Overwrite` parameter, the names of the volumes that are being overwritten must match the names of the volumes that are being restored. If the source is a protection group, the latest snapshot of the protection group will be used as the source during the copy operation. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
New-Pfa2ProtectionGroup -Array $Array -Name $ProtectionGroupName
Create a protection group on FlashArray with name $ProtectionGroupName

Top of page

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupHost

(REST API 2.1+) Add a host to a protection group

Adds a host member to a protection group. Members that are already in the protection group are not affected. For asynchronous replication, only members of the same type can belong to a protection group. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the host. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupHost [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupHost -Array $Array -GroupNames  $ProtectionGroupName -MemberNames $NewHost.Name
Add a host $NewHost.Name to protection group $ProtectionGroupName

Top of page

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupHostGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Add a host group to a protection group

Adds a host group member to a protection group. Members that are already in the protection group are not affected. For asynchronous replication, only members of the same type can belong to a protection group. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the host group. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.

-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot

(REST API 2.1+) Create a protection group snapshot

Creates a point-in-time snapshot of the contents of a protection group. The `SourceName` parameter is required.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-ApplyRetention <Boolean>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ForReplication <Boolean>] [-Id <String>] [-ProtectionGroupSnapshotName <String>] [-Replicate <Boolean>] [-ReplicateNow <Boolean>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-Suffix <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-ApplyRetention none If `$True`, applies the local and remote retention policy to the snapshots. false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ForReplication none (REST API 2.4+) If `$True`, destroys and eradicates the snapshot after 1 hour. false False None
-Id Ids (REST API 2.3+) A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified and cannot refer to another resource. false False None
-ProtectionGroupSnapshotName none (REST API 2.3+) A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None
-Replicate none (REST API 2.4+) If set to `$True`, queues up and begins replicating to each allowed target after all earlier replication sessions for the same protection group have been completed to that target. The `Replicate` and `ReplicateNow` parameters cannot be used together. false False None
-ReplicateNow none (REST API 2.4+) If set to `$True`, replicates the snapshots to each allowed target. The `Replicate` and `ReplicateNow` parameters cannot be used together. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames (REST API 2.3+) Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-Suffix none The name suffix appended to the protection group name to make up the full protection group snapshot name in the form `PGROUP.SUFFIX`. If `Suffix` is not specified, the protection group name is in the form `PGROUP.NNN`, where `NNN` is a unique monotonically increasing number. If multiple protection group snapshots are created at a time, the suffix name is appended to those snapshots. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot -Array $Array -SourceNames $ProtectionGroupName
Create a new protection group snapshot for group $ProtectionGroupName on FlashArray

Top of page

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTarget

(REST API 2.1+) Add a target to a protection group

Adds an array or offload target to a protection group. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group. The `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the array or offload target that is being added to the protection group. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.

-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupVolume

(REST API 2.1+) Create a volume and add it to a protection group

Creates a volume member and adds it to a protection group. Members that are already in the protection group are not affected. For asynchronous replication, only members of the same type can belong to a protection group. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` and `MemberId` parameters represent the names or IDs of the volume. The `GroupName` and only one of `MemberName` or `MemberId` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupVolume [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupVolume -Array $Array -GroupNames $ProtectionGroupName -MemberNames $VolumeName
Add a volume $VolumeName to protection group $ProtectionGroupName

New-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroupSnapshot

(REST API 2.4+) Create remote protection group snapshot

Creates remote protection group snapshots.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroupSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-ApplyRetention <Boolean>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ConvertSourceToBaseline <Boolean>] [-ForReplication <Boolean>] [-Id <String>] [-Name <String>] [-On <String>] [-Replicate <Boolean>] [-ReplicateNow <Boolean>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-Suffix <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-ApplyRetention none If `$True`, applies the local and remote retention policy to the snapshots. false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ConvertSourceToBaseline none Set to `$True` to have the snapshot be eradicated when it is no longer baseline on source. false False None
-ForReplication none If `$True`, destroys and eradicates the snapshot after 1 hour. false False None
-Id Ids A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified and cannot refer to another resource. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-On none Performs the operation on the target name specified. For example, `targetName01`. false False None
-Replicate none If set to `$True`, queues up and begins replicating to each allowed target after all earlier replication sessions for the same protection group have been completed to that target. The `Replicate` and `ReplicateNow` parameters cannot be used together. false False None
-ReplicateNow none If set to `$True`, replicates the snapshots to each allowed target. The `Replicate` and `ReplicateNow` parameters cannot be used together. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-Suffix none Specifies a name suffix for the snapshots created. The snapshot is created on the FlashArray specified by the `On` parameter. The `On` parameter cannot refer to an offload target. Snapshots with suffixes specified have names in the form `PGROUP.SUFFIX` instead of the default `PGROUP.NNN` form. The names of all snapshots created by a single command that specifies this option have the same suffix. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2SnmpManager

(REST API 2.4+) Create SNMP manager

Creates a Purity SNMP manager object that identifies a host (SNMP manager) and specifies the protocol attributes for communicating with it. Once a manager object is created, the transmission of SNMP traps is immediately enabled.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2SnmpManager [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Host <String>] [-Name <String>] [-Notification <String>] [-V2cCommunity <String>] [-V3AuthPassphrase <String>] [-V3AuthProtocol <String>] [-V3PrivacyPassphrase <String>] [-V3PrivacyProtocol <String>] [-V3User <String>] [-Version <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Host none DNS hostname or IP address of a computer that hosts an SNMP manager to which Purity//FA is to send trap messages when it generates alerts. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Notification none The type of notification the agent will send. Valid values are `inform` and `trap`. false False None
-V2cCommunity none The v2c configurations of SNMP. The v2c configurations of SNMP. false False None
-V3AuthPassphrase none The v3 configurations of SNMP. The v3 configurations of SNMP. false False None
-V3AuthProtocol none The v3 configurations of SNMP. The v3 configurations of SNMP. false False None
-V3PrivacyPassphrase none The v3 configurations of SNMP. The v3 configurations of SNMP. false False None
-V3PrivacyProtocol none The v3 configurations of SNMP. The v3 configurations of SNMP. false False None
-V3User none The v3 configurations of SNMP. The v3 configurations of SNMP. false False None
-Version Versions Version of the SNMP protocol to be used by Purity//FA to communicate with the specified manager. Valid values are `v2c` and `v3`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2SoftwareCheck

(REST API 2.9+) Create a software check task

Creates a software check task. If there are no previously queued or running software check tasks, the new task immediately starts. Otherwise, it is queued and starts once all previously queued or running software check tasks finish. To create a task, use a software name and version.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2SoftwareCheck [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-SoftwareName <List<String>>] [-SoftwareVersion <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-SoftwareName SoftwareNames A list of software names. false False None
-SoftwareVersion SoftwareVersions A list of target software versions. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2SoftwareInstallation

(REST API 2.3+) Create a software upgrade

Creates and initiates a software upgrade.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2SoftwareInstallation [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Mode <String>] [-OverrideChecksArgs <List<String>>] [-OverrideChecksName <List<String>>] [-OverrideChecksPersistent <List<Boolean>>] -SoftwareId <List<String>> [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Mode none Mode that the upgrade is in. Valid values are `check-only`, `interactive`, `semi-interactive`, and `one-click`. The `check_only` mode is deprecated. Use `/software-checks`. In this mode, the upgrade only runs pre-upgrade checks and returns. In `interactive` mode, the upgrade pauses at several points, at which users must enter certain commands to proceed. In `semi-interactive` mode, the upgrade pauses if there are any upgrade check failures and functions like `one-click` mode otherwise. In `one-click` mode, the upgrade proceeds automatically without pausing. false False None
-OverrideChecksArgs none The name of the specific check within the override check to ignore so that the system can continue with the software upgrade. The `OverrideChecksName` parameter of the override check must be specified with the `OverrideChecksArgs` parameter. For example, if the HostIOCheck check fails on hosts host01 and host02, the system displays a list of these host names in the failed check. To override the HostIOCheck checks for host01 and host02, set `OverrideChecksName=HostIOCheck`, and set `OverrideChecksArgs=host01,host02`. Enter multiple `OverrideChecksArgs`. Note that not all checks have `OverrideChecksArgs` values.


reference: OverrideCheck		 false False None
-OverrideChecksName none The name of the upgrade check to be overridden so the software upgrade can continue if the check failed or is anticipated to fail during the upgrade process. Overriding the check forces the system to ignore the check failure and continue with the upgrade. If the check includes more specific checks that failed or are anticipated to fail, set them using the `OverrideChecksArgs` parameter. For example, the HostIOCheck check may include a list of hosts that have failed or are anticipated to fail the upgrade check.


reference: OverrideCheck		 false False None
-OverrideChecksPersistent none If set to `$True`, the system always ignores the failure of the specified upgrade check and continues with the upgrade process. If set to `$False`, the system ignores the failure of the specified upgrade check until the upgrade check finishes and the upgrade process is continued. For example, the `continue` command is successfully issued in an `interactive` mode, or the first upgrade check step successfully finishes in a `one-click` mode.


reference: OverrideCheck		 false False None
-SoftwareId SoftwareIds A list of software IDs. true False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2SsoSaml2

-ArrayUrl none The URL of the array. false False None
-IdpEncryptAssertionEnabled none Properties specific to the identity provider. Properties specific to the identity provider. false False None
-IdpEntityId none Properties specific to the identity provider. Properties specific to the identity provider. false False None
-IdpMetadataUrl none Properties specific to the identity provider. Properties specific to the identity provider. false False None
-IdpSignRequestEnabled none Properties specific to the identity provider. Properties specific to the identity provider. false False None
-IdpUrl none Properties specific to the identity provider. Properties specific to the identity provider. false False None
-IdpVerificationCertificate none Properties specific to the identity provider. Properties specific to the identity provider. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. For example, `name01`. Enter multiple names. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-SpDecryptionCredentialName none Properties specific to the service provider. Properties specific to the service provider. false False None
-SpSigningCredentialName none Properties specific to the service provider. Properties specific to the service provider. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

New-Pfa2Subnet

(REST API 2.2+) Create subnet

Creates a subnet with the specified parameters.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Subnet [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Gateway <String>] [-Mtu <Int32>] -Name <String> [-Prefix <String>] [-Vlan <Int32>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Enabled none Returns a value of `$True` if subnet is enabled. Returns a value of `$False` if subnet is disabled. If not specified, defaults to `$True`. false False None
-Gateway none The IPv4 or IPv6 address of the gateway through which the specified subnet is to communicate with the network. false False None
-Mtu none Maximum message transfer unit (packet) size for the subnet in bytes. MTU setting cannot exceed the MTU of the corresponding physical interface. If not specified, defaults to `1500`.


minimum: 1280


maximum: 9216		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. For example, `name01`. Enter multiple names. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Prefix none The IPv4 or IPv6 address to be associated with the specified subnet. false False None
-Vlan none VLAN ID number. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
New-Pfa2Subnet -Array $Array -Name $Name -Enabled $true -Gateway $Geteway -Mtu $Mtu -Prefix $Prefix -Vlan $Vlan
Create a new subnet with parameters of name, enabled, gateway, mtu, prefix, and vlan

New-Pfa2SyslogServer

(REST API 2.4+) Create syslog server

Creates a new syslog server. Transmission of syslog messages is enabled immediately.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2SyslogServer [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Name <String>] [-Uri <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Uri Uris The URI of the syslog server in the format `PROTOCOL://HOSTNAME:PORT`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2VirtualMachine

(REST API 2.10+) Create a virtual machine

Creates one or more virtual machines from a protection group snapshot. If the virtual machine is of type `vvol`, the `source` property of the request body must be a `recovery_context` value retrieved from the `Get-Pfa2VirtualMachine /virtual-machine-snapshots` endpoint. If `Overwrite` is specified, an existing virtual machine will have its volumes overwritten by the snapshot. Otherwise, a new virtual machine will be created from the snapshot. If creating the new virtual machine will cause a conflict with an existing virtual machine, the operation will fail.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2VirtualMachine [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Id <String>] [-Overwrite <Boolean>] [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-VmId <String>] [-VmType <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Id Ids The ID of the virtual machine to create or modify, as assigned by the external system. `Id` is deprecated. Use `VmId` instead. false False None
-Overwrite none If set to `$True`, overwrites an existing volume during a volume copy operation. If set to `$False` or not set at all and the target name is an existing volume, the volume copy operation fails. Required if the `source: id` or `source: name` body parameter is set and the source overwrites an existing volume during the volume copy operation. false False None
-SourceId SourceIds The recovery context for the virtual machine or virtual machine snapshot being modified. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames The recovery context for the virtual machine or virtual machine snapshot being modified. false False None
-VmId VmIds (REST API 2.14+) The ID of the virtual machine to create or modify, as assigned by the external system. false False None
-VmType none The type of virtual machine. The only valid value is `vvol`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2Volume

(REST API 2.0+) Create a volume

Creates one or more virtual storage volumes of the specified size. If `Provisioned` is not specified, the size of the new volume defaults to 1MB. (`Provisioned` sets the virtual size of the volume, measured in bytes. Volume size must be a multiple of 512 bytes between 1 MB and 4PB. Byte multipliers KB, MB, GB, TB and PB are supported, with no space between number and multiplier, such as `1PB`. Maximum value 4503599627370496.) The `Name` query parameter is required. The `AddToProtectionGroupNames` query parameter specifies a list of protection group names that will compose the initial protection for the volume. The `WithDefaultProtection` query parameter specifies whether to use the container default protection configuration for the volume. The `AddToProtectionGroupNames` and `WithDefaultProtection` query parameters cannot be provided when `Overwrite` is `$True`. For more information of creating volumes under SafeMode, run `Get-Help About_Pfa2Safemode`

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-Overwrite <Boolean>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] [-QosBandwidthLimit <Int64>] [-QosIopsLimit <Int64>] [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-Subtype <String>] [-WithDefaultProtection <Boolean>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

New-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-Overwrite <Boolean>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] -QosBandwidthLimit <Int64> [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-Subtype <String>] [-WithDefaultProtection <Boolean>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

New-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-Overwrite <Boolean>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] -QosIopsLimit <Int64> [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-Subtype <String>] [-WithDefaultProtection <Boolean>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

New-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-Overwrite <Boolean>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-Subtype <String>] [-WithDefaultProtection <Boolean>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AddToProtectionGroupNames none The volumes will be added to the specified protection groups along with creation or movement across pods and array. When a volume is moved, the specified protection groups must be in the target pod or array. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Overwrite none If set to `$True`, overwrites an existing volume during a volume copy operation. If set to `$False` or not set at all and the target name is an existing volume, the volume copy operation fails. Required if the `source: id` or `source: name` body parameter is set and the source overwrites an existing volume during the volume copy operation. false False None
-PriorityAdjustmentOperator PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentOperator (REST API 2.10+) Adjusts volume priority. Adjusts volume priority. false False None
-PriorityAdjustmentValue PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentValue (REST API 2.10+) Adjusts volume priority. Adjusts volume priority. false False None
-Provisioned none Sets the virtual size of the volume, measured in bytes.


maximum: 4503599627370496		 false False None
-QosBandwidthLimit none (REST API 2.3+) Sets QoS limits. Sets QoS limits.


minimum: 1048576


maximum: 549755813888		 false False None
-QosBandwidthLimitReset none (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosBandwidthLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS bandwidth set for the volume. false False False
-QosIopsLimit none (REST API 2.3+) Sets QoS limits. Sets QoS limits.


minimum: 100


maximum: 100000000		 false False None
-QosIopsLimitReset none (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosIopsLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS IOPs set for the volume. false False False
-SourceId SourceIds (REST API 2.3+) The source volume of a volume copy. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames (REST API 2.3+) The source volume of a volume copy. false False None
-Subtype none The type of volume. Valid values are `protocol_endpoint` and `regular`. false False None
-WithDefaultProtection none If specified as `$True`, the initial protection of the newly created volumes will be the union of the container default protection configuration and `AddToProtectionGroupNames`. If specified as `$False`, the default protection of the container will not be applied automatically. The initial protection of the newly created volumes will be configured by `AddToProtectionGroupNames`. If not specified, defaults to `$True`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
New-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Provisioned $size -Name $VolumeName
Create a new volume on FlashArray with provisioned size as $Size and name $VolumeName
Example 2 
New-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Provisioned $size -Name $VolumeName -ApiVersion $_
Create a new volume on FlashArray using a specific REST version with ApiVersion param
Example 3 
$VolumeName1,$VolumeName2,$VolumeName3,$VolumeName4,$VolumeName5 | New-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Provisioned $Size
Create five volumes using pipeline, all with provisioned size $Size
Example 4 
New-Pfa2Volume -Name $name -Provisioned $Size
Create a new volume with name $name on FlashArray. Here the FlashArray authentication information is retrieved from Cache. Please see Connect-Pfa2Array

Top of page

New-Pfa2VolumeGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Create a volume group

Creates a volume group. The volume group does not contain any meaningful content. The volume group acts as a container that is used to organize volumes. Once a volume group has been created, volumes can be created inside the volume group or moved into and out of the volume group.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Id <String>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-QosBandwidthLimit <Int64>] [-QosIopsLimit <Int64>] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

New-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Id <String>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] -QosBandwidthLimit <Int64> [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

New-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Id <String>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] -QosIopsLimit <Int64> [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

New-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Id <String>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Id Ids (REST API 2.3+) A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified and cannot refer to another resource. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PriorityAdjustmentOperator PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentOperator (REST API 2.10+) Valid values are `+`, `-`, and `=`. The values `+` and `-` may be applied to volumes and volume groups to reflect the relative importance of their workloads. Volumes and volume groups can be assigned a priority adjustment of -10, 0, or +10. In addition, volumes can be assigned values of =-10, =0, or =+10. Volumes with settings of -10, 0, +10 can be modified by the priority adjustment setting of a volume group that contains the volume. However, if a volume has a priority adjustment set with the `=` operator (for example, =+10), it retains that value and is unaffected by any volume group priority adjustment settings. false False None
-PriorityAdjustmentValue PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentValue (REST API 2.10+) Adjust priority by the specified amount, using the `PriorityAdjustmentOperator`. Valid values are 0 and +10 for `+` and `-` operators, -10, 0, and +10 for the `=` operator. false False None
-QosBandwidthLimit none (REST API 2.3+) The maximum QoS bandwidth limit for the volume. Whenever throughput exceeds the bandwidth limit, throttling occurs. Measured in bytes per second. Maximum limit is 512 GB/s.


minimum: 1048576


maximum: 549755813888		 false False None
-QosBandwidthLimitReset none (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosBandwidthLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS bandwidth set for the volume group. false False False
-QosIopsLimit none (REST API 2.3+) The QoS IOPs limit for the volume.


minimum: 100


maximum: 100000000		 false False None
-QosIopsLimitReset none (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosIopsLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS IOPs set for the volume group. false False False
-VolumeGroupName none (REST API 2.3+) A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
New-Pfa2VolumeGroup -Array $Array -Name $VolumeGroupName
Create a new volume group on FlashArray with name $VolumeGroupName

Top of page

New-Pfa2VolumeProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Create a volume and add it to a protection group

Creates a volume member and adds it to a protection group. Members that are already in the protection group are not affected. For asynchronous replication, only members of the same type can belong to a protection group. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` and `MemberId` parameters represent the names or IDs of the volume. The `GroupName` and only one of `MemberName` or `MemberId` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2VolumeProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
New-Pfa2VolumeProtectionGroup -Array $Array -GroupNames $ProtectionGroupName -MemberNames $Volume.Name
Add a volume $Volume.Name to protection group $ProtectionGroupName on FlashArray

Top of page

New-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot

(REST API 2.0+) Create a volume snapshot

Creates a point-in-time snapshot of the contents of a volume. The `SourceId` or `SourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-On <String>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-Suffix <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-On none Performs the operation on the target name specified. For example, `targetName01`. false False None
-SourceId SourceIds Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-Suffix none The suffix that is appended to the `source_name` value to generate the full volume snapshot name in the form `VOL.SUFFIX`. If the suffix is not specified, the system constructs the snapshot name in the form `VOL.NNN`, where `VOL` is the volume name, and `NNN` is a monotonically increasing number. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
New-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot -Array $Array -Suffix "powershell" -SourceNames $Volume.Name
Create a volume snapshot with suffix "powershell" for volume $Volume.Name on FlashArray

-LocalOnly none If specified as `$True`, only delete the Active Directory configuration on the local array, without deleting the computer account created in the Active Directory domain. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. For example, `name01`. Enter multiple names. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Top of page

Remove-Pfa2Array

(REST API 2.4+) Delete an array

Deletes an array. For physical appliances, deleting an array restores the hardware to factory settings. This entails deleting all data, metadata, configuration, and logs. The array returns to the state it was in prior to any configuration changes being made. If the hardware is reused, it must be as a different array with a new ID. For virtual appliances, deleting an array puts it into an unusable state. Virtual resources (e.g., virtual machines) can later be freed, which deletes any remaining data, metadata, configuration, and logs. Prior to factory reset, an array must be manually prepared (e.g., all volumes and snapshots must be eradicated) and a factory reset token must be created.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2Array [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-EradicateAllData <Boolean>] [-FactoryResetToken <Int64>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-EradicateAllData none Set to `$True` to perform a factory reset. false False None
-FactoryResetToken none A token required to perform a factory reset. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2ArrayCloudProviderTag

(REST API 2.6+) Delete user tags from the cloud.

Deletes user tags from deployed cloud resources of a CBS array.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2ArrayCloudProviderTag [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Key <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Key Keys A list of tag keys. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2Connection

(REST API 2.0+) Delete a connection between a volume and its host or host group

Deletes the connection between a volume and its associated host or host group. The `VolumeName` or `VolumeId` and `HostName` or `HostGroupName` query parameters are required.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2Connection [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-HostGroupName <List<String>>] [-HostName <List<String>>] [-VolumeId <List<String>>] [-VolumeName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-HostGroupName HostGroupNames Performs the operation on the host group specified. Enter multiple names. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple host group names and volume names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `HostGroupName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `hgroup01`). false False None
-HostName HostNames Performs the operation on the hosts specified. Enter multiple names. For example, `host01,host02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple host names and volume names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `HostName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `host01`). false False None
-VolumeId VolumeIds Performs the operation on the specified volume. Enter multiple ids. For example, `vol01id,vol02id`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple IDs. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple volume IDs and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `VolumeId`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `vol01id`). Only one of the two between `VolumeName` and `VolumeId` may be used at a time. false False None
-VolumeName VolumeNames Performs the operation on the volume specified. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple volume names and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `VolumeName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `vol01`). false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Remove-Pfa2Connection -Array $Array -HostNames $Host_.Name -VolumeNames $Volume.Name
Remove the connection between volume $Volume.Name and host $Host_.Name
Example 2 
Remove-Pfa2Connection -Array $Array -HostGroupNames $HostGroup.Name -VolumeNames $Volume.Name
Remove the connection between volume $Volume.Name and host group $HostGroup.Name

Top of page

Remove-Pfa2Directory

(REST API 2.3+) Delete managed directories

Deletes one or more managed directories. To be deleted, a managed directory must be empty and not attached to any enabled export policies. Deleted managed directories cannot be recovered. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2Directory [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2DirectoryExport

(REST API 2.3+) Delete directory exports

Deletes one or more directory exports. If any of the `ExportName` is not unique across the system, `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` must be specified to determine the exports.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2DirectoryExport [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ExportName <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ExportName ExportNames Performs the operation on the export names specified. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

Outputs

Deletes a membership between a directory with one or more auto managed directory policies. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Remove-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalUserMember

Delete local user membership

Deletes one or more local user memberships. The `MemberName`, `MemberSid`, or `MemberId` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalUserMember [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-GroupGid <List<Int>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-GroupSid <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<Int>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-MemberSid <List<String>>] [-MemberType <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-GroupGid GroupGids Performs the operation on the specified GIDs. Enter multiple GIDs. For example, `4234235,9681923`. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the group names specified. Enter multiple group names. For example, `group1,group2`. false False None
-GroupSid GroupSids Performs the operation on the specified group SID. Enter multiple group SIDs. For example, `S-1-2-532-582374278-329482934,S-1-2-532-234235245-423425234`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique local member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. For local group IDs refer to group IDs (GID). For local user IDs refer to user IDs (UID). The `MemberId` and `MemberName` parameters cannot be provided together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-MemberSid MemberSids Performs the operation on the specified member SID. Enter multiple member SIDs. For example, `S-1-2-532-582374278-329482934,S-1-2-532-234235245-423425234`. false False None
-MemberType MemberTypes Performs the operation on the member types specified. The type of member is the full name of the resource endpoint. Valid values include `directories`. Enter multiple member types. For example, `type01,type02`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Remove-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot

(REST API 2.3+) Delete directory snapshot

Deletes a directory snapshot that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated directory snapshots cannot be recovered. Directory snapshots are destroyed by using the Update-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot method. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-Eradicate] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-Eradicate none Permanently delete DirectorySnapshot false False False
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2Host

(REST API 2.0+) Delete a host

Deletes an existing host. All volumes that are connected to the host, either through private or shared connections, must be disconnected from the host before the host can be deleted. The `Name` query parameter is required.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2Host [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Name <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Remove-Pfa2Host -Array $Array -Name $HostName
Remove a host named $HostName

Top of page

Top of page

Remove-Pfa2HostGroupHost

(REST API 2.1+) Remove a host from a host group

Removes a host from a host group. Removing a host from a host group automatically disconnects the host from all volumes associated with the group. Hosts can be removed from host groups at any time. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together, and only one host group can be specified at a time.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2HostGroupHost [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Remove-Pfa2HostGroupHost -Array $Array -GroupNames  $HostGroupName -MemberNames $NewHost.Name
Remove host $NewHost.Name from host group $HostGroupName

Top of page

Remove-Pfa2HostGroupProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a host group from a protection group

Deletes a host group member from a protection group. After the member has been removed, it is no longer protected by the group. Any protection group snapshots that were taken before the member was removed are not affected. Removing a member from a protection group does not delete the member from the array, and the member can be added back to the protection group at any time. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the host group. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2HostGroupProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Remove-Pfa2HostGroupProtectionGroup -Array $Array -GroupNames  $ProtectionGroupName -MemberNames $NewHostGroup.Name
Remove host group $NewHostGroup.Name from protection group $ProtectionGroupName

Top of page

Remove-Pfa2HostHostGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Remove a host from a host group

Removes a host from a host group. Removing a host from a host group automatically disconnects the host from all volumes associated with the group. Hosts can be removed from host groups at any time. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together, and only one host group can be specified at a time.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2HostHostGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Remove-Pfa2HostHostGroup -Array $Array -GroupNames  $HostGroupName -MemberNames $NewHost.Name
Remove host $NewHost.Name from host group $HostGroupName

Top of page

Remove-Pfa2HostProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a host from a protection group

Deletes a host member from a protection group. After the member has been removed, it is no longer protected by the group. Any protection group snapshots that were taken before the member was removed are not affected. Removing a member from a protection group does not delete the member from the array, and the member can be added back to the protection group at any time. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the host. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.

-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Top of page

Remove-Pfa2Pod

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a pod

Deletes (eradicates) a pod that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated pods cannot be recovered. Pods are destroyed using the `Update-Pfa2Pod` cmdlet. The `Ids` or `Name` parameter is required, but cannot be set together. If SafeMode is enabled then `Update-Pfa2Pod -DestroyContents $True -Destroyed $True` must be called first.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2Pod [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-Eradicate] [-EradicateContents <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-Eradicate none Permanently delete Pod false False False
-EradicateContents none (REST API 2.3+) Set to `$True` to eradicate contents (e.g., volumes, protection groups, snapshots) and containers (e.g., pods, volume groups). This enables you to eradicate containers with contents. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.5+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Remove-Pfa2Pod -Array $TargetArray -Name $RemotePodName -Eradicate  -Confirm:$false
Eradicate a remote pod with name $RemotePodName
Example 2 
Remove-Pfa2Pod -Array $Array -Name $Pod.Name -Eradicate -Confirm:$false -ErrorAction Stop
Eradicate a POD $Pod.Name (Only destroyed PODs can be eradicated)

Top of page

Remove-Pfa2PodArray

(REST API 2.1+) Unstretch a pod from an array

Unstretches a pod from an array, collapsing the pod to a single array. Unstretch a pod from an array when the volumes within the stretched pod no longer need to be synchronously replicated between the two arrays. After a pod has been unstretched, synchronous replication stops. A destroyed version of the pod with "restretch" appended to the pod name is created on the array that no longer has the pod. The restretch pod represents a point-in-time snapshot of the pod, just before it was unstretched. The restretch pod enters an eradication pending period starting from the time that the pod was unstretched. A restretch can pod can be cloned or destroyed, but it cannot be explicitly recovered. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the pod to be unstretched. The `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the array from which the pod is to be unstretched. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2PodArray [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-WithUnknown <Boolean>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A list of group IDs. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-WithUnknown none If set to `$True`, unstretches the specified pod from the specified array by force. Use the `WithUnknown` parameter in the following rare event: the local array goes offline while the pod is still stretched across two arrays, the status of the remote array becomes unknown, and there is no guarantee that the pod is online elsewhere. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2PodReplicaLink

(REST API 2.2+) Delete pod replica links

Deletes pod replica links. The `LocalPodName` and `RemotePodName` are required. Valid values are `replicating`, `baselining`, `paused`, `unhealthy`, `quiescing`, and `quiesced`. A status of `replicating` indicates that the source array is replicating to the target array. A status of `baselining` indicates that the the initial version of the dataset is being sent. During this phase, you cannot promote the target pod. In addition, changing the link direction might trigger the `baselining` status to recur. A status of `paused ` indicates that data transfer between objects has stopped. A status of `unhealthy` indicates that the link is currently unhealthy and customers must perform some health checks to determine the cause. A status of `quiescing` indicates that the source pod is not accepting new write requests but the most recent changes to the source have not arrived on the target. A status of `quiesced` indicates that the source pod has been demoted and all changes have been replicated to the target pod.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2PodReplicaLink [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-LocalPodId <List<String>>] [-LocalPodName <List<String>>] [-RemotePodId <List<String>>] [-RemotePodName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `names` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-LocalPodId LocalPodIds A list of local pod IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `LocalPodName` query parameter. false False None
-LocalPodName LocalPodNames A list of local pod names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `LocalPodId` query parameter. false False None
-RemotePodId RemotePodIds A list of remote pod IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemotePodName` query parameter. false False None
-RemotePodName RemotePodNames A list of remote pod names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemotePodId` query parameter. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Remove-Pfa2PodReplicaLink -Array $Array -LocalPodNames $LocalPodName -RemotePodNames $RemotePodName
Remove a POD replica link from FlashArray where local pod names is $LocalPodName and remote pod names is $RemotePodName

Top of page
