Remove-Pfa2PolicyAutodirMember

Delete auto managed directory policies

Deletes one or more auto managed directory policies from resources. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2PolicyAutodirMember [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-MemberType <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-MemberType MemberTypes Performs the operation on the member types specified. The type of member is the full name of the resource endpoint. Valid values include `directories`. Enter multiple member types. For example, `type01,type02`. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

Remove-Pfa2PolicyQuotaRule

(REST API 2.7+) Delete quota policy rules

Deletes one or more quota policy rules. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2PolicyQuotaRule [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Name <String>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2PolicySmbMember

(REST API 2.3+) Delete SMB policies

Deletes one or more SMB policies from resources. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2PolicySmbMember [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-MemberType <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-MemberType MemberTypes Performs the operation on the member types specified. The type of member is the full name of the resource endpoint. Valid values include `directories`. Enter multiple member types. For example, `type01,type02`. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a protection group

Deletes a protection group that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated protection groups cannot be recovered. Protection groups are destroyed through the `Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup` method. The `Name` parameter is required.

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroup Aliases

  • Remove-Pfa2PGroup

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-Eradicate] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-Eradicate none Permanently delete ProtectionGroup false False False
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroup -Array $Array -Name $NewProtectionGroupName -Eradicate -Confirm:$false
Eradicate protection group with name $NewProtectionGroupName (Only destroyed protection groups can be eradicated)

Top of page

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupHost

(REST API 2.1+) Remove a host from a protection group

Removes a host member from a protection group. After the member has been removed, it is no longer protected by the group. Any protection group snapshots that were taken before the member was removed will not be affected. Removing a member from a protection group does not delete the member from the array, and the member can be added back to the protection group at any time. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the host. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupHost [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupHost -Array $Array -GroupNames  $ProtectionGroupName -MemberNames $NewHost.Name
Remove a host $NewHost.Name from protection group $ProtectionGroupName

Top of page

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupHostGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Remove a host group from a protection group

Removes a host group member from a protection group. After the member has been removed, it is no longer protected by the group. Any protection group snapshots that were taken before the member was removed will not be affected. Removing a member from a protection group does not delete the member from the array, and the member can be added back to the protection group at any time. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the host group. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupHostGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupHostGroup -Array $Array -GroupNames  $ProtectionGroupName -MemberNames $NewHostGroup.Name
Remove a host group $NewHostGroup.Name from protection group $ProtectionGroupName

Top of page

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a protection group snapshot

Deletes a protection group snapshot that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicating a protection group snapshot eradicates all of its protection group snapshots and cannot be recovered. Protection group snapshots are destroyed through the `Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot` method. The `Name` parameter is required.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-Eradicate] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-Eradicate none (REST API 2.3+) Permanently delete ProtectionGroupSnapshot false False False
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot -Array $Array -Name $SnapshotName
Eradicate a protection group snapshot named $SnapshotName

Top of page

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTarget

(REST API 2.1+) Removes a target from a protection group

Removes an array or offload target from a protection group. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group. The `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the array or offload target that is being removed from the protection group. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTarget [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTarget -Array $testarray -GroupNames $ProtectionGroupName -MemberNames $NFSTargetName

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupVolume

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a volume from a protection group

Deletes a volume member from a protection group. After the member has been deleted, it is no longer protected by the group. Any protection group snapshots that were taken before the member was deleted are not affected. Deleting a member from a protection group does not delete the member from the array, and the member can be added back to the protection group at any time. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` and `MemberId` parameters represent the names or IDs of the volume. The `GroupName` and only one of `MemberName` or `MemberId` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupVolume [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupVolume -Array $Array -GroupNames  $ProtectionGroupName -MemberNames $NewVolume.Name
Remove a volume $NewVolume.Name from protection group $ProtectionGroupName on FlashArray

Top of page

Remove-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Eradicate a remote protection group

Eradicates a remote protection group that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated remote protection groups cannot be recovered. Remote protection groups are destroyed through the `Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup` method. The `On` parameter represents the name of the offload target. The `Id` or `Name` parameter and the `On` parameter are required and must be used together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-Eradicate] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-On <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-Eradicate none (REST API 2.3+) Permanently delete RemoteProtectionGroup false False False
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-On none Performs the operation on the target name specified. For example, `targetName01`. false False None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Remove-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup -Array $Array -Name $RemotePGname -On "nfstarget"
Eradicate the remote protection group $RemotePGName from offload target "nfstarget"

Top of page

Remove-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroupSnapshot

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a remote protection group snapshot

Deletes a remote protection group snapshot that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated remote protection group snapshots cannot be recovered. Remote protection group snapshots are destroyed using the `Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroupSnapshot` method. The `Name` parameter represents the name of the protection group snapshot. The `On` parameter represents the name of the offload target. The `Name` and `On` parameters are required and must be used together.

Remove-Pfa2RemoteVolumeSnapshot

(REST API 2.4+) Eradicate a remote volume snapshot

Eradicates a remote volume snapshot that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated remote volume snapshots cannot be recovered. Remote volume snapshots are destroyed through the `Update-Pfa2RemoteVolumeSnapshot` method. The `Name` parameter represents the name of the volume snapshot. The `On` parameter represents the name of the offload target. The `Name` and `On` parameters are required and must be used together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2RemoteVolumeSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-Eradicate] [-Name <String>] [-On <String>] [-ReplicationSnapshot <Boolean>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-Eradicate none Permanently delete RemoteVolumeSnapshot false False False
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-On none Performs the operation on the target name specified. For example, `targetName01`. false False None
-ReplicationSnapshot none If set to `$True`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots in use by replication. If set to `$False`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots not in use by replication. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2SnmpManager

(REST API 2.4+) Delete SNMP manager

Deletes the SNMP manager object and stops communication with specified managers.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2Software

(REST API 2.11+) Delete a software package

Deletes a software package specified by software name and version. A software package being used for an installation can be deleted if the installation is `downloading`, `downloaded`, `aborted`, or `finished`. If the software package is currently `downloading`, the download will be cancelled.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2Software [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Name <String>] [-SoftwareVersion <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-SoftwareVersion SoftwareVersions A list of target software versions. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2SoftwareCheck

(REST API 2.9+) Delete a software check task

Deletes a software check task specified by software name and version. The check task must be queued. If the check task is running or passed/failed then the task cannot be deleted.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2SoftwareCheck [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-SoftwareName <List<String>>] [-SoftwareVersion <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-SoftwareName SoftwareNames A list of software names. false False None
-SoftwareVersion SoftwareVersions A list of target software versions. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2Subnet

(REST API 2.2+) Delete subnet

Deletes subnets. A subnet can only be deleted if it has no interfaces. Interfaces must be removed by using the `network-interfaces` endpoint.

Remove-Pfa2Volume

(REST API 2.0+) Delete a volume

Deletes (eradicates) a volume that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated volumes cannot be recovered. Volumes are destroyed using the `Update-Pfa2Volume` cmdlet. The `Ids` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2Volume [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-Eradicate] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-Eradicate none Permanently delete Volume false False False
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Remove-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Name $vol.Name -Eradicate -Confirm:$false
Eradicate a volume $vol.Name (Only destroyed volumes can be eradicated)
Example 2 
Remove-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Name $Volume.Name
Destroy the volume named $Volume.Name
Example 3 
Remove-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Eradicate -Whatif
Display the the action will be performed without execution. The action here is eradicating the volume named $Volume.Name
Example 4 
Remove-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Name $Volume.Name -Eradicate -Confirm:$false -Whatif
Display the the action will be performed without execution. The action here is eradicating the volume named $Volume.Name without cofirmation

Top of page

Remove-Pfa2VolumeGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a volume group

Deletes a volume group that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated volume groups cannot be recovered. Volume groups are destroyed through the Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup method. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-Eradicate] [-EradicateContents <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-Eradicate none Permanently delete VolumeGroup false False False
-EradicateContents none (REST API 2.3+) Set to `$True` to eradicate contents (e.g., volumes, protection groups, snapshots) and containers (e.g., pods, volume groups). This enables you to eradicate containers with contents. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Remove-Pfa2VolumeGroup -Array $Array -Name $VolGroup.name -Eradicate -Confirm:$false
Eradicate a volume group $VolGroup.Name (Only destroyed volume groups can be eradicated)

Top of page

Remove-Pfa2VolumeProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a volume from a protection group

Deletes a volume member from a protection group. After the member has been deleted, it is no longer protected by the group. Any protection group snapshots that were taken before the member was deleted are not affected. Deleting a member from a protection group does not delete the member from the array, and the member can be added back to the protection group at any time. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` and `MemberId` parameters represent the names or IDs of the volume. The `GroupName` and only one of `MemberName` or `MemberId` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2VolumeProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Remove-Pfa2VolumeProtectionGroup -Array $Array -GroupNames $PG.Name -MemberNames $hst.Member.Name
Remove the host $hst.Member.Name from protection group $PG.Name from FlashArray

Top of page

Remove-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot

(REST API 2.0+) Delete a volume snapshot

Deletes a volume snapshot that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated volume snapshots cannot be recovered. Volume snapshots are destroyed by using the `Update-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot` method. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-Eradicate] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-ReplicationSnapshot <Boolean>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-Eradicate none Permanently delete VolumeSnapshot false False False
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-ReplicationSnapshot none (REST API 2.4+) If set to `$True`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots in use by replication. If set to `$False`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots not in use by replication. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Remove-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot -Array $Array -Name $Result.Name -Eradicate -Confirm:$false
Eradicate a volume snapshot on FlashArray for volume snapshot $Result.Name (Only destroyed snapshots can be eradicated)s

Top of page

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value

-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Key Keys A list of tag keys. false False None
-Namespaces none A list of namespaces. Only one namespace is allowed per delete request. false False None
-ResourceId ResourceIds A list of resource IDs. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-ResourceName ResourceNames A list of resource names. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Set-Pfa2VolumeSnapshotTagsBatch

(REST API 2.2+) Update tags

Updates tags.

Syntax 

Set-Pfa2VolumeSnapshotTagsBatch [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ResourceId <List<String>>] [-ResourceName <List<String>>] [-TagCopyable <List<Boolean>>] [-TagKey <List<String>>] [-TagNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagResourceId <List<String>>] [-TagResourceName <List<String>>] [-TagValue <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ResourceId ResourceIds A list of resource IDs. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-ResourceName ResourceNames A list of resource names. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-TagCopyable none (REST API 2.3+) Specifies whether or not to include the tag when copying the parent resource. If set to `$True`, the tag is included in resource copying. If set to `$False`, the tag is not included. If not specified, defaults to `$True`. Provide at least 1 value(s) and at most 30 value(s).


reference: Tag		 false False None
-TagKey none (REST API 2.3+) Key of the tag. Supports up to 64 Unicode characters. Provide at least 1 value(s) and at most 30 value(s).


reference: Tag		 false False None
-TagNamespace none (REST API 2.3+) Optional namespace of the tag. Namespace identifies the category of the tag. Omitting the namespace defaults to the namespace `default`. The `pure*` namespaces are reserved for plugins and integration partners. It is recommended that customers avoid using reserved namespaces. Provide at least 1 value(s) and at most 30 value(s).


reference: Tag		 false False None
-TagResourceId none (REST API 2.3+) A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: FixedReference		 false False None
-TagResourceName none (REST API 2.3+) The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: FixedReference		 false False None
-TagValue none (REST API 2.3+) Value of the tag. Supports up to 256 Unicode characters. Provide at least 1 value(s) and at most 30 value(s).


reference: Tag		 false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Set-Pfa2VolumeSnapshotTagsBatch -Array $Array -Tag $Tag -ResourceNames $Result.Name
Set a tag on volume snapshot with name $Result.Name on FlashArray (See New-Pfa2TagObject)

If set to `$False`, the tag is not included. If not specified, defaults to `$True`. Provide at least 1 value(s) and at most 30 value(s).


reference: Tag		 false False None

reference: Tag		 false False None

The `pure*` namespaces are reserved for plugins and integration partners. It is recommended that customers avoid using reserved namespaces. Provide at least 1 value(s) and at most 30 value(s).


reference: Tag		 false False None

reference: Tag		 false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Syntax

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. For example, `name01`. Enter multiple names. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Tls none TLS mode for communication with domain controllers. Valid values are `required` and `optional`. `required` forces TLS communication with domain controller. `optional` allows the use of non-TLS communication, TLS will still be preferred, if available. If not specified, defaults to `required`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

  • System.String

Update-Pfa2Admin

(REST API 2.2+) Modify an administrator

Modifies properties for the specified administrator.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Admin [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Locked <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-OldPassword <SecureString>] [-Password <SecureString>] [-PublicKey <String>] [-RoleName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Locked none Returns a value of `$True` if the user is currently locked out, otherwise `$False`. Can be patched to `$False` to unlock a user. This field is only visible to `array_admin` roles. For all other users, the value is always `null`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-OldPassword none The current password. false False None
-Password none Password associated with the account. false False None
-PublicKey none Public key for SSH access. false False None
-RoleName RoleNames Privilege level. Valid values include `array_admin`, `storage_admin`, and `readonly`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2AdminSetting

(REST API 2.2+) Modify administrator settings

Modifies the global administrator settings for the array.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2AdminSetting [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-LockoutDuration <Int64>] [-MaxLoginAttempts <Int32>] [-MinPasswordLength <Int32>] [-SingleSignOnEnabled <Boolean>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-LockoutDuration none The lockout duration, in milliseconds, if a user is locked out after reaching the maximum number of login attempts. Ranges from 1 second to 90 days.


minimum: 1000


maximum: 7776000000		 false False None
-MaxLoginAttempts none Maximum number of failed login attempts allowed before the user is locked out.


minimum: 1


maximum: 20		 false False None
-MinPasswordLength none Minimum password length. If not specified, defaults to 1. false False None
-SingleSignOnEnabled none If `$True`, then single sign-on is enabled for the array. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2AdminSetting -Array $Array -LockoutDuration 1000 -MaxLoginAttempts 3 -MinPasswordLength 10
Update global array admin setting. Lockout duration to 1000 secs, maximum login attempts to 3 and minimum password length to 10
Example 2 
Update-Pfa2AdminSetting -Array $Array -MaxLoginAttempts 2
Update global array admin setting. Maximum login attempts to only 2
Example 3 
Update-Pfa2AdminSetting -Array $Array -LockoutDuration 2000
Update global array admin setting. Lockout duration to 2000 seconds

Top of page

Update-Pfa2Alert

(REST API 2.2+) Modify flagged state

Modifies one or more alerts and display updated information about these alerts.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Alert [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Flagged <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Flagged none If set to `$True`, the message is flagged. Important messages can can be flagged and listed separately. false False None
-Id Ids (REST API 2.3+) Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2Alert -Array $Array -Name $_.Name -Flagged $True
Flag an array alert with name $_.Name

Syntax

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Code none The alert code that the rule applies to. Available alert codes for customization can be found in the alert rules catalog. true False None
-Parameter none The parameter of the custom alert rule to modify. Values include `info` and `warning`. Available parameter values can be found in the alert rules catalog. true False None
-Value none The value to use for the custom alert rule. Valid values for an alert code and parameter combination can be found in the alert rules catalog. false False None

Update-Pfa2Array

(REST API 2.2+) Modify an array

Modifies general array properties such as the array name, login banner, idle timeout for management sessions, and NTP servers.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Array [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ArrayName <String>] [-Banner <String>] [-ConsoleLockEnabled <Boolean>] [-EradicationDelay <Int64>] [-Id <String>] [-IdleTimeout <Int32>] [-NtpServer <List<String>>] [-ScsiTimeout <Int32>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ArrayName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None
-Banner none Sets text that Purity users see in the GUI at login, and in the CLI just before the password prompt. false False None
-ConsoleLockEnabled none Enables or disables root user login at the physical (serial or VGA) console. false False None
-EradicationDelay EradicationConfigEradicationDelay (REST API 2.6+) The configuration of eradication feature. The configuration of eradication feature. false False None
-Id Ids (REST API 2.3+) A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified and cannot refer to another resource. false False None
-IdleTimeout none The idle timeout in milliseconds. Valid values include `0` and any multiple of `60000` in the range of `300000` and `10800000`. Any other values are rounded down to the nearest multiple of `60000`. false False None
-NtpServer NtpServers {{ Fill NtpServer Description }} false False None
-ScsiTimeout none The SCSI timeout. If not specified, defaults to `60s`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Example 1

Update FlashArray with a new idletimeout

Update FlashArray with a new ScsiTimeout

Update-Pfa2Certificate

(REST API 2.4+) Modify certificates

Modifies certificate attributes. When you modify the attributes of a self-signed certificate, Purity//FA replaces the existing certificate with a new certificate, which is generated with the specified attributes.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Certificate [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Certificate <String>] [-CommonName <String>] [-Country <String>] [-Days <Int32>] [-Email <String>] [-GenerateNewKey <Boolean>] [-IntermediateCertificate <String>] [-Key <String>] [-KeySize <Int32>] [-Locality <String>] [-Name <String>] [-Organization <String>] [-OrganizationalUnit <String>] [-Passphrase <String>] [-State <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Certificate none The text of the certificate. false False None
-CommonName none The common name field listed in the certificate. false False None
-Country none Two-letter country (ISO) code listed in the certificate. false False None
-Days none The number of days that the self-signed certificate is valid. If not specified, defaults to 3650. false False None
-Email none The email field listed in the certificate. false False None
-GenerateNewKey none If set to `$True`, a new private key is generated when generating a new certificate with the specified attributes. This may not be set to `$True` when importing a certificate and private key, and may not be set to `$False` when generating a new self-signed certificate to replace a certificate that was imported. Default setting is `$False`. false False None
-IntermediateCertificate none The text of the intermediate certificate chains. false False None
-Key Keys The text of private key. false False None
-KeySize none The size of the private key for the certificate in bits. Default is 2048 bits. false False None
-Locality none The locality field listed in the certificate. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Organization none The organization field listed in the certificate. false False None
-OrganizationalUnit none The organizational unit field listed in the certificate. false False None
-Passphrase none The passphrase used to encrypt `private_key`. false False None
-State none The state/province field listed in the certificate. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

reference: DefaultProtectionReference		 false False None

reference: DefaultProtectionReference		 false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the container ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. Specifying `Id` or `Name` with no value will perform the operation on local array. false False None

-DirectoryName DirectoryNames The managed directory name without the file system name prefix. A full managed directory name is constructed in the form of `FILE_SYSTEM:DIR` where `FILE_SYSTEM` is the file system name and `DIR` is the value of this field. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-BaseDn none Base of the Distinguished Name (DN) of the directory service groups. false False None
-BindPassword none Masked password used to query the directory. false False None
-BindUser none Username used to query the directory. false False None
-CaCertificate none The certificate of the Certificate Authority (CA) that signed the certificates of the directory servers, which is used to validate the authenticity of the configured servers. false False None
-CheckPeer none Whether or not server authenticity is enforced when a certificate is provided. false False None
-Enabled none Whether or not the directory service is enabled. false False None

-ManagementUserObjectClass none (REST API 2.3+) Properties specific to the management service. Properties specific to the management service. false False None

-Uri Uris List of URIs for the configured directory servers. false False None

Update-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalUser

Modify local user

Modifies a local user.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalUser [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Email <String>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-KeepOpenSessions <Boolean>] [-LocalUserName <String>] [-Name <String>] [-Password <String>] [-PrimaryGroupId <String>] [-PrimaryGroupName <String>] [-PrimaryGroupResourceType <String>] [-Sid <List<String>>] [-Uid <Int32>] [-Uids <List<Int>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Email none Optional field to set the email of the local user. false False None
-Enabled none If this field is `$False`, the local user will be disabled on creation. Otherwise, the local user will be enabled and functional from the beginning. false False None
-KeepOpenSessions none If set to `$True`, the session does not expire. If set to `$False`, when the user is disabled or password is changed, the session expires. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-LocalUserName none The local user name. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Password none The password of the local user. This field is only required if the `Enabled` field is $True. false False None
-PrimaryGroupId none Local group that would be assigned as the primary group of the local user. false False None
-PrimaryGroupName none Local group that would be assigned as the primary group of the local user. false False None
-PrimaryGroupResourceType none Local group that would be assigned as the primary group of the local user. Local group that would be assigned as the primary group of the local user. false False None
-Sid Sids Performs the operation on the object SID specified. Enter multiple SIDs. For example, `S-1-2-532-582374278-329482934,S-1-2-532-234235245-423425234`. false False None
-Uid none Optional field to set the UID of the local user. false False None
-Uids none A list of local user IDs (UIDs). Enter multiple local user IDs. For example, `423,51234`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

-Group none Common Name (CN) of the directory service group that contains users with the authority level of the specified role name. false False None
-GroupBase none Specifies where the configured group is located in the directory tree. false False None
-RoleName RoleNames (REST API 2.3+) Performs the operation on the unique roles specified. For example, `array_admin`. Enter multiple roles. true False None

Top of page

Update-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot

(REST API 2.3+) Modify directory snapshot

Modifies a directory snapshot. You can destroy, recover, or update the policy or time remaining of a directory snapshot. To destroy a directory snapshot, set `Destroyed=$True`. To recover a directory snapshot that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `Destroyed=$False`. To rename a directory snapshot, set `DirectorySnapshotName` to the new name. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ClientName <String>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-DirectorySnapshotName <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-KeepFor <Int64>] [-Name <String>] [-PolicyId <String>] [-PolicyName <String>] [-Suffix <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ClientName none (REST API 2.9+) The client name portion of the client-visible snapshot name. A full snapshot name is constructed in the form of `DIR.CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX` where `DIR` is the managed directory name, `CLIENT_NAME` is the value of this field, and `SUFFIX` is the suffix. The client-visible snapshot name is `CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX`. The client name of a directory snapshot managed by a snapshot policy is not changeable. If the `DirectorySnapshotName` and `ClientName` parameters are both specified, `ClientName` must match the client name portion of `DirectorySnapshotName`. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-DirectorySnapshotName none (REST API 2.9+) The new name of a directory snapshot. The name of a directory snapshot managed by a snapshot policy is not changeable. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-KeepFor none The amount of time to keep the snapshots, in milliseconds. Can only be set on snapshots that are not managed by any snapshot policy. Set to `""` to clear the keep_for value. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PolicyId PolicyIds The snapshot policy that manages this snapshot. Set to `DirectorySnapshotName` or `PolicyId` to `""` to clear the policy. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames The snapshot policy that manages this snapshot. Set to `DirectorySnapshotName` or `PolicyId` to `""` to clear the policy. false False None
-Suffix none (REST API 2.9+) The suffix portion of the client-visible snapshot name. A full snapshot name is constructed in the form of `DIR.CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX` where `DIR` is the managed directory name, `CLIENT_NAME` is the client name, and `SUFFIX` is the value of this field. The client-visible snapshot name is `CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX`. The suffix of a directory snapshot managed by a snapshot policy is not changeable. If the `DirectorySnapshotName` and `Suffix` parameters are both specified, `Suffix` must match the suffix portion of `DirectorySnapshotName`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2Dns

(REST API 2.2+) Modify DNS parameters

Modifies the DNS parameters of an array, including the domain suffix, the list of DNS name server IP addresses, and the list of services that DNS parameters apply to. If there is no DNS configuration beforehand new DNS configuration with 'default' name is created. If more than one DNS configuration exists `DnsName` has to be specified to identify the DNS configuration to be modified.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Dns [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-DnsName <String>] [-Domain <String>] [-Name <String>] [-NameServer <List<String>>] [-Service <List<String>>] [-SourceName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-DnsName none (REST API 2.15+) The new name for the resource. false False None
-Domain none The domain suffix to be appended by the appliance when performing DNS lookups. false False None
-Name none (REST API 2.15+) Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-NameServer Nameservers The list of DNS server IP addresses. false False None
-Service Services The list of services utilizing the DNS configuration. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames (REST API 2.15+) The network interface used for communication with the DNS server. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2DNS -Array $Array -NameServers $nameServers -Domain $domain
Update dns informaion with new values of NameServers and Domain

Update-Pfa2FileSystem

(REST API 2.3+) Modify a file system

Modifies a file system. You can rename, destroy, move, or recover a file system. To rename a file system, set `FileSystemName` to the new name. To destroy a file system, set `Destroyed=$True`. To move a file system, set 'pod' to the destination pod reference. To recover a file system that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `Destroyed=$False`.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2FileSystem [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-FileSystemName <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PodId <String>] [-PodName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-FileSystemName FileSystemNames The new name for the resource. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PodId none (REST API 2.13+) The pod to move existing file systems into. false False None
-PodName none (REST API 2.13+) The pod to move existing file systems into. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2Host

(REST API 2.0+) Modify a host

Modifies an existing host, including its storage network addresses, CHAP, host personality, and preferred arrays, or associate a host to a host group. The `Name` query parameter is required.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Host [-AddIqn <List<String>>] [-AddNqn <List<String>>] [-AddWwn <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ChapHostPassword <String>] [-ChapHostUser <String>] [-ChapTargetPassword <String>] [-ChapTargetUser <String>] [-HostGroupName <String>] [-HostName <String>] [-Iqn <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-Nqn <List<String>>] [-Personality <String>] [-PreferredArraysId <List<String>>] [-PreferredArraysName <List<String>>] [-RemoveIqn <List<String>>] [-RemoveNqn <List<String>>] [-RemoveWwn <List<String>>] [-Vlan <String>] [-Wwn <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AddIqn AddIqns Adds the specified iSCSI Qualified Names (IQNs) to those already associated with the specified host. false False None
-AddNqn AddNqns Adds the specified NVMe Qualified Names (NQNs) to those already associated with the specified host. false False None
-AddWwn AddWwns Adds the specified Fibre Channel World Wide Names (WWNs) to those already associated with the specified host. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ChapHostPassword none (REST API 2.3+) Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). false False None
-ChapHostUser none (REST API 2.3+) Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). false False None
-ChapTargetPassword none (REST API 2.3+) Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). false False None
-ChapTargetUser none (REST API 2.3+) Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). false False None
-HostGroupName HostGroupNames The host group to which the host should be associated. false False None
-HostName HostNames The new name for the resource. false False None
-Iqn Iqns The iSCSI qualified name (IQN) associated with the host. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Nqn Nqns The NVMe Qualified Name (NQN) associated with the host. false False None
-Personality none Determines how the system tunes the array to ensure that it works optimally with the host. Set `Personality` to the name of the host operating system or virtual memory system. Valid values are `aix`, `esxi`, `hitachi-vsp`, `hpux`, `oracle-vm-server`, `solaris`, and `vms`. If your system is not listed as one of the valid host personalities, do not set the option. By default, the personality is not set. false False None
-PreferredArraysId none (REST API 2.3+) A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-PreferredArraysName none (REST API 2.3+) The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-RemoveIqn RemoveIqns Disassociates the specified iSCSI Qualified Names (IQNs) from the specified host. false False None
-RemoveNqn RemoveNqns Disassociates the specified NVMe Qualified Names (NQNs) from the specified host. false False None
-RemoveWwn RemoveWwns Disassociates the specified Fibre Channel World Wide Names (WWNs) from the specified host. false False None
-Vlan none The VLAN ID that the host is associated with. If not set, there is no change in VLAN. If set to `any`, the host can access any VLAN. If set to `untagged`, the host can only access untagged VLANs. If set to a number between `1` and `4094`, the host can only access the specified VLAN with that number. false False None
-Wwn Wwns The Fibre Channel World Wide Name (WWN) associated with the host. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2Host -Array $Array -Name $HostName -iqns $iqns -Chap $newChap
Find a host named $HostName and update its values of Name, iqns, and Chap
Example 2 
Update-Pfa2Host -Array $Array -Name $HostName -HostGroupName $HostGroupName
Find a host named $HostName and update its host group.

Update-Pfa2Pod

(REST API 2.1+) Modify a pod

Modifies pod details.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Pod [-AbortQuiesce <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-DestroyContents <Boolean>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-FailoverPreferencesId <List<String>>] [-FailoverPreferencesName <List<String>>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-Mediator <String>] [-Name <String>] [-PodName <String>] [-PromoteFrom <String>] [-Quiesce <Boolean>] [-QuotaLimit <Int64>] [-RequestedPromotionState <String>] [-SkipQuiesce <Boolean>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AbortQuiesce none (REST API 2.2+) Set to `$True` to promote the pod when the `pod-replica-link` is in the `quiescing` state and abort when waiting for the `pod-replica-link` to complete the quiescing operation. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-DestroyContents none (REST API 2.3+) Set to `$True` to destroy contents (e.g., volumes, protection groups, snapshots) and containers (e.g., pods, volume groups). This enables you to destroy containers with contents. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, the pod has been destroyed and is pending eradication. The `TimeRemaining` value displays the amount of time left until the destroyed pod is permanently eradicated. A pod can only be destroyed if it is empty, so before destroying a pod, ensure all volumes and protection groups inside the pod have been either moved out of the pod or destroyed. A stretched pod cannot be destroyed unless you unstretch it first. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed pod can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the pod is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-FailoverPreferencesId none (REST API 2.3+) A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-FailoverPreferencesName none (REST API 2.3+) The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-Id Ids (REST API 2.3+) Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-IgnoreUsage none Set to `$True` to set a `QuotaLimit` that is lower than the existing usage. This ensures that no new volumes can be created until the existing usage drops below the `QuotaLimit`. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-Mediator none Sets the URL of the mediator for this pod, replacing the URL of the current mediator. By default, the Pure1 Cloud Mediator (`purestorage`) serves as the mediator. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PodName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None
-PromoteFrom none (REST API 2.2+) The `undo-demote` pod that should be used to promote the pod. After the pod has been promoted, it will have the same data as the `undo-demote` pod and the `undo-demote` pod will be eradicated. false False None
-Quiesce none (REST API 2.2+) Set to `$True` to demote the pod after the `pod-replica-link` goes into `quiesced` state and allow the pod to become a target of the remote pod. This ensures that all local data has been replicated to the remote pod before the pod is demoted. false False None
-QuotaLimit none The logical quota limit of the pod, measured in bytes. Must be a multiple of 512.


minimum: 1048576


maximum: 4503599627370496		 false False None
-RequestedPromotionState none (REST API 2.2+) Patch `RequestedPromotionState` to `demoted` to demote the pod so that it can be used as a link target for continuous replication between pods. Demoted pods do not accept write requests, and a destroyed version of the pod with `undo-demote` appended to the pod name is created on the array with the state of the pod when it was in the promoted state. Patch `RequestedPromotionState` to `promoted` to start the process of promoting the pod. The `promotion_status` indicates when the pod has been successfully promoted. Promoted pods stop incorporating replicated data from the source pod and start accepting write requests. The replication process does not stop when the source pod continues replicating data to the pod. The space consumed by the unique replicated data is tracked by the `space.journal` field of the pod. false False None
-SkipQuiesce none (REST API 2.2+) Set to `$True` to demote the pod without quiescing the `pod-replica-link` and allow the pod to become a target of the remote pod. This stops all pending replication to the remote pod. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.5+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2Pod -Array $TargetArray -Name $RemotePodName -Destroyed $true
Destroy a remote pod with name $RemotePodName (This is not eradicated)
Example 2 
Update-Pfa2Pod -Array $TargetArray -Name $RemotePod.Name -RequestedPromotionState "demoted"
Demote a remote POD with name $RemotePod.Name on FlashArray
Example 3 
Update-Pfa2Pod -Array $Array -Name $Pod.Name -Destroyed $True -ErrorAction Stop
Destroy a POD $Pod.Name. Assert if there is an error. (POD is not eradicated, see Remove-Pfa2Pod)

Top of page

Update-Pfa2PodReplicaLink

(REST API 2.2+) Modify pod replica links

Modifies pod replica links. The `LocalPodName` and `RemotePodName` are required. Valid values are `replicating`, `baselining`, `Paused`, `unhealthy`, `quiescing`, and `quiesced`. A status of `replicating` indicates that the source array is replicating to the target array. A status of `baselining` indicates that the the initial version of the dataset is being sent. During this phase, you cannot promote the target pod. In addition, changing the link direction might trigger the `baselining` status to recur. A status of `paused ` indicates that data transfer between objects has stopped. A status of `unhealthy` indicates that the link is currently unhealthy and customers must perform some health checks to determine the cause. A status of `quiescing` indicates that the source pod is not accepting new write requests but the most recent changes to the source have not arrived on the target. A status of `quiesced` indicates that the source pod has been demoted and all changes have been replicated to the target pod.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2PodReplicaLink [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-LocalPodId <List<String>>] [-LocalPodName <List<String>>] [-Paused <Boolean>] [-RemoteId <List<String>>] [-RemoteName <List<String>>] [-RemotePodId <List<String>>] [-RemotePodName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `names` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-LocalPodId LocalPodIds A list of local pod IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `LocalPodName` query parameter. false False None
-LocalPodName LocalPodNames A list of local pod names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `LocalPodId` query parameter. false False None
-Paused none Returns a value of `$True` if the replica link is to be created in a `Paused` state. Returns a value of `$False` if the replica link is to be created not in a `Paused` state. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-RemoteId RemoteIds A list of remote array IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemoteName` query parameter. false False None
-RemoteName RemoteNames A list of remote array names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemoteId` query parameter. false False None
-RemotePodId RemotePodIds A list of remote pod IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemotePodName` query parameter. false False None
-RemotePodName RemotePodNames A list of remote pod names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemotePodId` query parameter. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2PodReplicaLink -Array $Array -LocalPodNames $LocalPodName -RemotePodNames $RemotePodName -Paused $True
Update the POD replica link status to paused where local pod names is $LocalPodName and remote pod names is $RemotePodName

Top of page

Update-Pfa2PolicyAutodir

Modify auto managed directory policies

Modifies one or more auto managed directory policies. To enable a policy, set `Enabled=$True`. To disable a policy, set `Enabled=$True`. To rename a policy, set `PolicyName` to the new name. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax

-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Enabled none If set to `$True`, enables the policy. If set to `$False`, disables the policy. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PolicyName PolicyNames The new name for the resource. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Update-Pfa2PolicyNfs

Modifies one or more NFS policies. To enable a policy, set `Enabled=$True`. To disable a policy, set `Enabled=$False`. To rename a policy, set `PolicyName` to the new name. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax
