Update-Pfa2PolicyQuota

(REST API 2.7+) Modify quota policies

Modifies one or more quota policies. To enable a policy, set `Enabled=$True`. To disable a policy, set `Enabled=$False`. To rename a policy, set `PolicyName` to the new name. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2PolicyQuota [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-PolicyName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Enabled none If set to `$True`, enables the policy. If set to `$False`, disables the policy. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-IgnoreUsage none Flag used to override checks for quota management operations. If set to `$True`, directory usage is not checked against the `quota_limits` that are set. If set to `$False`, the actual logical bytes in use are prevented from exceeding the limits set on the directory. Client operations might be impacted. If the limit exceeds the quota, the client operation is not allowed. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PolicyName PolicyNames The new name for the resource. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2PolicyQuotaRule

(REST API 2.15+) Modify quota policy rules

Modifies quota policy rules.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2PolicyQuotaRule [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-RulesEnforced <List<Boolean>>] [-RulesNotifications <List<String>>] [-RulesQuotaLimit <List<Int>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-IgnoreUsage none Flag used to override checks for quota management operations. If set to `$True`, directory usage is not checked against the `quota_limits` that are set. If set to `$False`, the actual logical bytes in use are prevented from exceeding the limits set on the directory. Client operations might be impacted. If the limit exceeds the quota, the client operation is not allowed. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-RulesEnforced none If set to `$True`, this rule describes an enforced quota. An out-of-space warning is issued if logical space usage exceeds the limit value described in this rule. If set to `$False`, this rule describes an unenforced quota. Alerts and/or notifications are issued when logical space usage exceeds the limit value described in this rule.


reference: PolicyrulequotapatchRules		 false False None
-RulesNotifications none Targets to notify when usage approaches the quota limit. The list of notification targets is a comma-separated string. Valid values are one or more of `user` and `group`. To notify no targets, use `none`.


reference: PolicyrulequotapatchRules		 false False None
-RulesQuotaLimit none Logical space limit of the quota (in bytes) assigned by the rule. This value cannot be set to 0.


reference: PolicyrulequotapatchRules		 false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2PolicySmb

(REST API 2.3+) Modify SMB policies

Modifies one or more SMB policies. To enable a policy, set `Enabled=$True`. To disable a policy, set `Enabled=$False`. To enable access based enumeration, set `AccessBasedEnumerationEnabled=$True`. To disable access based enumeration, set `AccessBasedEnumerationEnabled=$False`. To rename a policy, set `PolicyName` to the new name. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2PolicySmb [-AccessBasedEnumerationEnabled <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PolicyName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AccessBasedEnumerationEnabled none (REST API 2.4+) If set to `$True`, enables access based enumeration on the policy. When access based enumeration is enabled on a policy, files and folders within exports that are attached to the policy will be hidden from users who do not have permission to view them. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Enabled none If set to `$True`, enables the policy. If set to `$False`, disables the policy. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PolicyName PolicyNames The new name for the resource. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2PolicySnapshot

(REST API 2.3+) Modify snapshot policies

Modifies one or more snapshot policies. To enable a policy, set `Enabled=$True`. To disable a policy, set `Enabled=$True`. To rename a policy, set `PolicyName` to the new name. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax

-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PolicyName PolicyNames The new name for the resource. false False None

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Modify a protection group

Modifies the protection group schedules to generate and replicate snapshots to another array or to an external storage system. Renames or destroys a protection group.

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup Aliases

  • Update-Pfa2PGroup

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-ProtectionGroupName <String>] [-ReplicationScheduleAt <Int64>] [-ReplicationScheduleBlackoutEnd <Int64>] [-ReplicationScheduleBlackoutStart <Int64>] [-ReplicationScheduleEnabled <Boolean>] [-ReplicationScheduleFrequency <Int64>] [-RetentionLock <String>] [-SnapshotScheduleAt <Int64>] [-SnapshotScheduleEnabled <Boolean>] [-SnapshotScheduleFrequency <Int64>] [-SourceRetentionAllForSec <Int32>] [-SourceRetentionDays <Int32>] [-SourceRetentionPerDay <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionAllForSec <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionDays <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionPerDay <Int32>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none Has this protection group been destroyed? To destroy a protection group, patch to `$True`. To recover a destroyed protection group, patch to `$False`. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-ProtectionGroupName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None
-ReplicationScheduleAt none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule of a replication action. The schedule of a replication action.


maximum: 86399000		 false False None
-ReplicationScheduleBlackoutEnd none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule of a replication action. The schedule of a replication action. The schedule of a replication action. The schedule of a replication action. false False None
-ReplicationScheduleBlackoutStart none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule of a replication action. The schedule of a replication action. The schedule of a replication action. The schedule of a replication action. false False None
-ReplicationScheduleEnabled none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule of a replication action. The schedule of a replication action. false False None
-ReplicationScheduleFrequency none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule of a replication action. The schedule of a replication action.


minimum: 300000


maximum: 34560000000		 false False None
-RetentionLock none (REST API 2.13+) The valid values are `ratcheted` and `unlocked`. The default value for a newly created protection group is `unlocked`. Set `RetentionLock` to `ratcheted` to enable SafeMode restrictions on the protection group. Contact Pure Technical Services to change `RetentionLock` to `unlocked`. false False None
-SnapshotScheduleAt none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule settings for protection group snapshots. The schedule settings for protection group snapshots.


maximum: 86399000		 false False None
-SnapshotScheduleEnabled none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule settings for protection group snapshots. The schedule settings for protection group snapshots. false False None
-SnapshotScheduleFrequency none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule settings for protection group snapshots. The schedule settings for protection group snapshots.


minimum: 300000


maximum: 34560000000		 false False None
-SourceRetentionAllForSec none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the source array of the protection group. The retention policy for the source array of the protection group.


minimum: 60


maximum: 34560000		 false False None
-SourceRetentionDays none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the source array of the protection group. The retention policy for the source array of the protection group.


maximum: 4000		 false False None
-SourceRetentionPerDay none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the source array of the protection group. The retention policy for the source array of the protection group.


maximum: 1440		 false False None
-TargetRetentionAllForSec none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group. The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group.


minimum: 60


maximum: 34560000		 false False None
-TargetRetentionDays none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group. The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group.


maximum: 4000		 false False None
-TargetRetentionPerDay none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group. The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group.


maximum: 1440		 false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup -Array $Array -Name $ProtectionGroupName -ProtectionGroupName $NewProtectionGroupName
Update the name of protection group from $ProtectionGroupName to $NewProtectionGroupName
Example 2 
Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup -Array $Array -Destroyed $true -Name $NewProtectionGroupName
Destroy the protection group with name $NewProtectionGroupname (This is not Eradicated)

Top of page

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot

(REST API 2.1+) Modify a protection group snapshot

Modifies a protection group snapshot so that it can be destroyed. To destroy a volume, set `Destroyed=$True`. To recover a volume that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `Destroyed=$False`. The `Name` parameter is required.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-ProtectionGroupSnapshotName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none Returns a value of `$True` if the protection group snapshot has been destroyed and is pending eradication. The `TimeRemaining` value displays the amount of time left until the destroyed snapshot is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed snapshot can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the snapshot is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-ProtectionGroupSnapshotName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot -Array $Array -Name $SnapshotName -Destroyed $true
Destroy a protection group snapshot named $SnapshotName
Example 2 
Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot -Array $Array -Name $DefaultSnapshotName -ProtectionGroupSnapshotName $NewSnapshotName
Update a protection group snapshot name to $NewSnapshotName from $DefaultSnapshotName

Top of page

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTarget

(REST API 2.1+) Manage a protection group target

Allows the source array to replicate protection group data to the target array, or disallows the source array from replicating protection group data to the target array. The `Allowed` parameter must be set from the target array. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group. The `Allowed` and `GroupName` parameters are required and must be set together. Offload targets do not support the `Allowed` parameter.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTarget [-Allowed <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-Allowed none If set to `$True`, the target array has allowed the source array to replicate protection group data to the target array. If set to `$False`, the target array has not allowed the source array to replicate protection group data to the target. target-protection-group false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
# Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTarget -Array $Array -GroupNames $RemotePGName -MemberNames "nfstarget" -Allowed $False
Disallowing a target in a protection group is not supported for offload targets

Top of page

Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Manage a remote protection group

Configures the snapshot retention schedule of a remote protection group. Also destroys a remote protection group from the offload target. Before the remote protection group can be destroyed, the offload target must first be removed from the protection group via the source array. The `On` parameter represents the name of the offload target. The `Id` or `Name` parameter and the `On` parameter are required and must be used together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-On <String>] [-TargetRetentionAllForSec <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionDays <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionPerDay <Int32>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none Returns a value of `$True` if the remote protection group has been destroyed and is pending eradication. The `TimeRemaining` value displays the amount of time left until the destroyed remote protection group is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed remote protection group can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the remote protection group is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Id Ids (REST API 2.3+) Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-On none Performs the operation on the target name specified. For example, `targetName01`. false False None
-TargetRetentionAllForSec none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the remote protection group. The retention policy for the remote protection group.


minimum: 60


maximum: 34560000		 false False None
-TargetRetentionDays none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the remote protection group. The retention policy for the remote protection group.


maximum: 4000		 false False None
-TargetRetentionPerDay none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the remote protection group. The retention policy for the remote protection group.


maximum: 1440		 false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup -Array $Array -Name $RemotePGName -On "nfstarget" -Destroyed $True
Destroy the remote protection group $RemotePGName on the offload target "nfstarget"
Example 2 
Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup -Array $Array -Name $RemotePGName -On "nfstarget" -TargetRetention $policy
Update retention policy for offload target "nfstarget" for protection group $RemotePGName on FlashArray (See New-Pfa2RetentionPolicyObject)

Top of page

Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroupSnapshot

(REST API 2.1+) Modify a remote protection group snapshot

Modifies a remote protection group snapshot, removing it from the offload target and destroying the snapshot. The `On` parameter represents the name of the offload target. The `ids` or `Name` parameter and the `On` parameter are required and must be used together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroupSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-On <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-On none Performs the operation on the target name specified. For example, `targetName01`. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Destroy a remote protection group snapshot named $PeergroupSnapshot on remote target $NFSTargetName

Update-Pfa2RemoteVolumeSnapshot

(REST API 2.4+) Manage a remote volume snapshot

Destroy or recover a remote volume snapshot from the offload target. The `On` parameter represents the name of the offload target. The `Name` parameter and the `On` parameter are required and must be used together.

Syntax

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-On none Performs the operation on the target name specified. For example, `targetName01`. false False None
-ReplicationSnapshot none If set to `$True`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots in use by replication. If set to `$False`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots not in use by replication. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Update-Pfa2SmiS

(REST API 2.2+) Modify SLP and SMI-S

Modifies the Service Location Protocol (SLP) and the SMI-S provider, enabling or disabling them.

Syntax

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-SlpEnabled none If set to `$True`, the Service Location Protocol (SLP) and its ports, TCP 427 and UDP 427, are enabled. false False None
-WbemHttpsEnabled none If set to `$True`, the SMI-S provider and its port, TCP 5989 is enabled. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Example 1

Update-Pfa2SmtpServer

(REST API 2.4+) Modify SMTP server attributes

Modifies SMTP server attributes. Values include `UserName`, `Password`, `RelayHost`, `SenderDomain`, and `name`.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2SmtpServer [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Password <SecureString>] [-RelayHost <String>] [-SenderDomain <String>] [-UserName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Password none Password for the relay host, if needed. false False None
-RelayHost none Relay server used as a forwarding point for email sent from the array. Can be set as a hostname, IPv4 address, or IPv6 address, with optional port numbers. The expected format for IPv4 is `ddd.ddd.ddd.ddd:PORT`. The expected format for IPv6 is `xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx` or, if a port number is specified, `[xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx]:PORT`. false False None
-SenderDomain none Domain name appended to alert email messages. false False None
-UserName none User name for the relay host, if needed. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Update-Pfa2SoftwareInstallation

(REST API 2.3+) Modify software upgrade

Modifies a software upgrade by continuing, retrying, or aborting it. All `override_checks` are updated before the command being issued if `add_override_checks` is present. The `override_checks` parameter is valid when `Command` is `continue` or `retry`.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2SoftwareInstallation [-AddOverrideChecksArgs <List<String>>] [-AddOverrideChecksName <List<String>>] [-AddOverrideChecksPersistent <List<Boolean>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] -Command <String> -CurrentStepId <String> [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AddOverrideChecksArgs none The name of the specific check within the override check to ignore so that the system can continue with the software upgrade. The `AddOverrideChecksName` parameter of the override check must be specified with the `AddOverrideChecksArgs` parameter. For example, if the HostIOCheck check fails on hosts host01 and host02, the system displays a list of these host names in the failed check. To override the HostIOCheck checks for host01 and host02, set `AddOverrideChecksName=HostIOCheck`, and set `AddOverrideChecksArgs=host01,host02`. Enter multiple `AddOverrideChecksArgs`. Note that not all checks have `AddOverrideChecksArgs` values.


reference: OverrideCheck		 false False None
-AddOverrideChecksName none The name of the upgrade check to be overridden so the software upgrade can continue if the check failed or is anticipated to fail during the upgrade process. Overriding the check forces the system to ignore the check failure and continue with the upgrade. If the check includes more specific checks that failed or are anticipated to fail, set them using the `AddOverrideChecksArgs` parameter. For example, the HostIOCheck check may include a list of hosts that have failed or are anticipated to fail the upgrade check.


reference: OverrideCheck		 false False None
-AddOverrideChecksPersistent none If set to `$True`, the system always ignores the failure of the specified upgrade check and continues with the upgrade process. If set to `$False`, the system ignores the failure of the specified upgrade check until the upgrade check finishes and the upgrade process is continued. For example, the `continue` command is successfully issued in an `interactive` mode, or the first upgrade check step successfully finishes in a `one-click` mode.


reference: OverrideCheck		 false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Command none A user command that interacts with the upgrade. Commands may only be issued when the upgrade is paused. Valid values are `continue`, `retry`, and `abort`. The `continue` command continues a `paused` upgrade. The `retry` command retries the previous step. The `abort` command aborts the upgrade. true False None
-CurrentStepId none The current step `id` of the installation. true False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2Subnet

(REST API 2.2+) Modify subnet

Modifies one or more specified subnet properties.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Subnet [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Gateway <String>] [-Mtu <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Prefix <String>] [-SubnetName <String>] [-Vlan <Int32>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Enabled none Returns a value of `$True` if subnet is enabled. Returns a value of `$False` if subnet is disabled. If not specified, defaults to `$True`. false False None
-Gateway none The IPv4 or IPv6 address of the gateway through which the specified subnet is to communicate with the network. false False None
-Mtu none Maximum message transfer unit (packet) size for the subnet in bytes. MTU setting cannot exceed the MTU of the corresponding physical interface. If not specified, defaults to `1500`.


minimum: 1280


maximum: 9216		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Prefix none The IPv4 or IPv6 address to be associated with the specified subnet. false False None
-SubnetName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None
-Vlan none VLAN ID number. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2Subnet -Array $Array -Name $Name -Enabled $false -Vlan $Vlan
Find a subnet of FlashArray by name and update with specific parameters

Update-Pfa2Support

(REST API 2.2+) Create connection path

Creates a connection path from the array to another array.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Support [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-PhonehomeEnabled <Boolean>] [-Proxy <String>] [-RemoteAssistActive <Boolean>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-PhonehomeEnabled none The status of phonehome. If set to `$True`, enable phonehome. If set to `$False`, disable phonehome. false False None
-Proxy none The value of the current proxy, which is used for connecting to cloud services such as phonehome, remote assist, etc. Specify the server name, including the scheme and proxy port number. false False None
-RemoteAssistActive none The status of a remote assist session. If set to `$True`, enable the remote assist session. If set to `$False`, disable the remote assist session. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2Support -array $Array -PhonehomeEnabled $false -Proxy $proxy -RemoteAssistActive $false
Update a connection path by setting values of Proxy, PhonehomeEnabled, and RemoteAssistActive

-LoggingSeverity none (REST API 2.9+) Returns the configured logging severity threshold for which events will be forwarded to the configured syslog servers. Default configuration is info level severity. Valid values are `debug`, `info`, and `notice`. false False None
-TlsAuditEnabled none Returns a value of `$True` if messages that are necessary in order to audit TLS negotiations performed by the array are forwarded to the configured syslog servers. false False None

Update-Pfa2VirtualMachine

(REST API 2.10+) Update a virtual machine

Updates a virtual machine, recovering it from the destroyed state. If the virtual machine is of type `vvol`, the `source` property of the request body must be a `recovery_context` value retrieved from the `Get-Pfa2VirtualMachine /virtual-machines` endpoint. If recovering the virtual machine will cause a conflict with an existing virtual machine, the operation will fail.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2VirtualMachine [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Id <String>] [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-VmId <String>] [-VmType <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Id Ids The ID of the virtual machine to create or modify, as assigned by the external system. `Id` is deprecated. Use `VmId` instead. false False None
-SourceId SourceIds The recovery context for the virtual machine or virtual machine snapshot being modified. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames The recovery context for the virtual machine or virtual machine snapshot being modified. false False None
-VmId VmIds (REST API 2.14+) The ID of the virtual machine to create or modify, as assigned by the external system. false False None
-VmType none The type of virtual machine. The only valid value is `vvol`. false False None
-XRequestId none Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2Volume

(REST API 2.0+) Modify a volume

Modifies a volume by renaming, destroying, or resizing it. To rename a volume, set `VolumeName` to the new name. To destroy a volume, set `Destroyed=$True`. To recover a volume that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `Destroyed=$False`. Set the bandwidth and IOPs limits of a volume through the respective `QosBandwidthLimit` and `QosIopsLimit` parameter. This moves the volume into a pod or volume group through the respective `pod` or `volume_group` parameter. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PodId <String>] [-PodName <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] [-QosBandwidthLimit <Int64>] [-QosIopsLimit <Int64>] [-RemoveFromProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-RequestedPromotionState <String>] [-Truncate <Boolean>] [-VolumeGroupId <String>] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-VolumeName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Update-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PodId <String>] [-PodName <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] -QosBandwidthLimit <Int64> [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-RemoveFromProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-RequestedPromotionState <String>] [-Truncate <Boolean>] [-VolumeGroupId <String>] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-VolumeName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Update-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PodId <String>] [-PodName <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] -QosIopsLimit <Int64> [-RemoveFromProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-RequestedPromotionState <String>] [-Truncate <Boolean>] [-VolumeGroupId <String>] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-VolumeName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Update-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PodId <String>] [-PodName <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-RemoveFromProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-RequestedPromotionState <String>] [-Truncate <Boolean>] [-VolumeGroupId <String>] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-VolumeName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AddToProtectionGroupNames none The volumes will be added to the specified protection groups along with creation or movement across pods and array. When a volume is moved, the specified protection groups must be in the target pod or array. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PodId none (REST API 2.3+) Moves the volume into the specified pod. false False None
-PodName none (REST API 2.3+) Moves the volume into the specified pod. false False None
-PriorityAdjustmentOperator PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentOperator (REST API 2.10+) Adjusts volume priority. Adjusts volume priority. false False None
-PriorityAdjustmentValue PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentValue (REST API 2.10+) Adjusts volume priority. Adjusts volume priority. false False None
-Provisioned none Updates the virtual size of the volume, measured in bytes.


maximum: 4503599627370496		 false False None
-QosBandwidthLimit none (REST API 2.3+) Sets QoS limits. Sets QoS limits.


minimum: 1048576


maximum: 549755813888		 false False None
-QosBandwidthLimitReset none (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosBandwidthLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS bandwidth set for the volume. false False False
-QosIopsLimit none (REST API 2.3+) Sets QoS limits. Sets QoS limits.


minimum: 100


maximum: 100000000		 false False None
-QosIopsLimitReset none (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosIopsLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS IOPs set for the volume. false False False
-RemoveFromProtectionGroupNames none The volumes will be removed from the specified protection groups in the source pod or array along with the move. This can only be used when moving volumes across pods and arrays and must include all protection groups that the volumes are members of before the move. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format. false False None
-RequestedPromotionState none (REST API 2.2+) Valid values are `promoted` and `demoted`. Patch `RequestedPromotionState` to `demoted` to demote the volume so that the volume stops accepting write requests. Patch `RequestedPromotionState` to `promoted` to promote the volume so that the volume starts accepting write requests. false False None
-Truncate none If set to `$True`, reduces the size of a volume during a volume resize operation. When a volume is truncated, Purity automatically takes an undo snapshot, providing a 24-hour window during which the previous contents can be retrieved. After truncating a volume, its provisioned size can be subsequently increased, but the data in truncated sectors cannot be retrieved. If set to `$False` or not set at all and the volume is being reduced in size, the volume copy operation fails. Required if the `Provisioned` parameter is set to a volume size that is smaller than the original size. false False None
-VolumeGroupId none (REST API 2.3+) Adds the volume to the specified volume group. false False None
-VolumeGroupName none (REST API 2.3+) Adds the volume to the specified volume group. false False None
-VolumeName VolumeNames The new name for the resource. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Destroyed $True -Name $vol.Name
Destroy a volume $vol.Name on FlashArray (Volume is not Eradicated, see Remove-Pfa2Volume)
Example 2 
Update-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Name $_.Name -VolumeGroup $VolGroupRef
Remove a reference between volume $_.Name and volume group $VolGroupRef (See New-Pfa2ReferenceObject for creating a $VolGroupRef)
Example 3 
Update-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Name $Volume.Name -Provisioned $NewSize -Truncate $True
Truncate a volume provisioned size on FlashArray
Example 4 
Update-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Name $Volume.Name -Provisioned $NewSize
Expand a volume provisioned size on FlashArray

Top of page

Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Modify a volume group

Modifies a volume group. You can rename, destroy, recover, or set QoS limits for a volume group. To rename a volume group, set `VolumeGroupName` to the new name. To destroy a volume group, set `Destroyed=$True`. To recover a volume group that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `Destroyed=$False`. Sets the bandwidth and IOPs limits of a volume group through the respective `QosBandwidthLimit` and `QosIopsLimit` parameter. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. Sets the priority adjustment for a volume group using the `PriorityAdjustmentOperator` and `PriorityAdjustmentValue` fields.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-DestroyContents <Boolean>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-QosBandwidthLimit <Int64>] [-QosIopsLimit <Int64>] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-DestroyContents <Boolean>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] -QosBandwidthLimit <Int64> [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-DestroyContents <Boolean>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] -QosIopsLimit <Int64> [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-DestroyContents <Boolean>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-DestroyContents none (REST API 2.3+) Set to `$True` to destroy contents (e.g., volumes, protection groups, snapshots) and containers (e.g., pods, volume groups). This enables you to destroy containers with contents. false False None
-Destroyed none Returns a value of `$True` if the volume group has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed volume group can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. After the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the volume group is permanently eradicated and cannot be recovered. false False None
-Id Ids (REST API 2.3+) Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PriorityAdjustmentOperator PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentOperator (REST API 2.10+) Valid values are `+`, `-`, and `=`. The values `+` and `-` may be applied to volumes and volume groups to reflect the relative importance of their workloads. Volumes and volume groups can be assigned a priority adjustment of -10, 0, or +10. In addition, volumes can be assigned values of =-10, =0, or =+10. Volumes with settings of -10, 0, +10 can be modified by the priority adjustment setting of a volume group that contains the volume. However, if a volume has a priority adjustment set with the `=` operator (for example, =+10), it retains that value and is unaffected by any volume group priority adjustment settings. false False None
-PriorityAdjustmentValue PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentValue (REST API 2.10+) Adjust priority by the specified amount, using the `PriorityAdjustmentOperator`. Valid values are 0 and +10 for `+` and `-` operators, -10, 0, and +10 for the `=` operator. false False None
-QosBandwidthLimit none (REST API 2.3+) The maximum QoS bandwidth limit for the volume. Whenever throughput exceeds the bandwidth limit, throttling occurs. Measured in bytes per second. Maximum limit is 512 GB/s.


minimum: 1048576


maximum: 549755813888		 false False None
-QosBandwidthLimitReset none (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosBandwidthLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS bandwidth set for the volume group. false False False
-QosIopsLimit none (REST API 2.3+) The QoS IOPs limit for the volume.


minimum: 100


maximum: 100000000		 false False None
-QosIopsLimitReset none (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosIopsLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS IOPs set for the volume group. false False False
-VolumeGroupName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup -Array $Array -Name $VolGroup.name -Destroyed $True
Destroy a volume group $VolGroup.Name. (Volume group is not eradicated, see Remove-Pfa2VolumeGroup)
Example 2 
Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup -Array $Array -Qos $qos -Name $VolumeGroup.Name
Find a volume group named $VolumeGroup.Name and update its Qos. Qos object could be created from New-Pfa2QosObject

Top of page

Update-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot

(REST API 2.0+) Modify a volume snapshot

Modifies a volume snapshot by renaming, destroying, or recovering it. To rename the suffix of a volume snapshot, set `VolumeSnapshotName` to the new suffix name. To recover a volume snapshot that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `Destroyed=$True`. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-ReplicationSnapshot <Boolean>] [-VolumeSnapshotName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-ReplicationSnapshot none (REST API 2.4+) If set to `$True`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots in use by replication. If set to `$False`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots not in use by replication. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-VolumeSnapshotName none The new name for the resource. false False None
-XRequestId none (REST API 2.3+) Supplied by client during request or generated by server. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot -Array $Array -Name $VolumeSnapshot.Name -VolumeSnapshotName $NewSuffix
Update a volume snapshot name to $NewSuffix on FlashArray
Example 2 
Update-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot -Array $Array -Destroyed $True -Name $VolumeSnapshot.Name
Destroy a volume snapshot for snapshot $VolumeSnapshot.Name
